commit_message:
[ZFSonLinux] Add share migration support

Add support of share migration feature to ZFsonLinux driver.

Implements BP zfsonlinux-share-migration

Change-Id: If9e1fec9a6d4f96d2bb5c176c6249fafc7e3e891
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/17/353417/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cfg.StrOpt( "zfs_migration_snapshot_prefix", required=True, default="tmp_snapshot_for_share_migration_", help="Set snapshot prefix for usage in ZFS migration. Required."), self.migration_snapshot_prefix = ( self.configuration.zfs_migration_snapshot_prefix) 'ssh_cmd': ssh_cmd, # used with replication and migration dataset_name + '@') def _get_migration_snapshot_prefix(self, share_instance): """Returns migration-based snapshot prefix.""" migration_snapshot_prefix = "%s_%s" % ( self.migration_snapshot_prefix, share_instance['id'].replace('-', '_')) return migration_snapshot_prefix def _get_migration_snapshot_tag(self, share_instance): """Returns migration- and time-based snapshot tag.""" current_time = timeutils.utcnow().isoformat() snapshot_tag = "%s_time_%s" % ( self._get_migration_snapshot_prefix(share_instance), current_time) snapshot_tag = ( snapshot_tag.replace('-', '_').replace('.', '_').replace(':', '_')) return snapshot_tag @ensure_share_server_not_provided def migration_check_compatibility( self, context, src_share_instance, dest_host, dest_driver_migration_info, share_server=None): """Is called to test compatibility with destination backend.""" return self.configuration.share_driver == ( dest_driver_migration_info.get("share_driver")) @ensure_share_server_not_provided def migration_get_driver_info(self, context, share, dest_host, share_server=None): """Is called to provide necessary driver migration logic.""" return { "share_driver": self.configuration.share_driver, "executor": zfs_utils.get_remote_shell_executor( ip=self.configuration.zfs_service_ip, port=22, conn_timeout=self.configuration.ssh_conn_timeout, login=self.configuration.zfs_ssh_username, password=self.configuration.zfs_ssh_user_password, privatekey=self.configuration.zfs_ssh_private_key_path, max_size=10, ), } @ensure_share_server_not_provided def migration_start( self, context, src_share_instance, dest_host, dest_driver_migration_info, dest_share_instance, access_rules, share_server=None, dest_share_server=None): """Is called to perform 1st phase of driver migration of a given share. """ src_dataset_name = self.private_storage.get( src_share_instance['id'], 'dataset_name') dst_dataset_name = self._get_dataset_name(dest_share_instance) ssh_cmd = '%(username)s@%(host)s' % { 'username': self.configuration.zfs_ssh_username, 'host': self.service_ip, } snapshot_tag = self._get_migration_snapshot_tag(dest_share_instance) src_snapshot_name = ( '%(dataset_name)s@%(snapshot_tag)s' % { 'snapshot_tag': snapshot_tag, 'dataset_name': src_dataset_name, } ) # Save valuable data to DB self.private_storage.update(src_share_instance['id'], { 'migr_snapshot_tag': snapshot_tag, }) self.private_storage.update(dest_share_instance['id'], { 'entity_type': 'share', 'dataset_name': dst_dataset_name, 'ssh_cmd': ssh_cmd, 'pool_name': share_utils.extract_host( dest_share_instance['host'], level='pool'), 'migr_snapshot_tag': snapshot_tag, }) # Create temporary snapshot on src host. self.execute('sudo', 'zfs', 'snapshot', src_snapshot_name) # Send/receive temporary snapshot cmd = ( 'nohup ' 'sudo zfs send -vDR ' + src_snapshot_name + ' ' '| ssh ' + ssh_cmd + ' ' 'sudo zfs receive -v ' + dst_dataset_name + ' ' '& exit 0' ) self.execute(cmd, shell=True) @ensure_share_server_not_provided def migration_continue( self, context, src_share_instance, dest_host, dest_driver_migration_info, dest_share_instance, access_rules, share_server=None, dest_share_server=None): """Is called in source share's backend to continue migration.""" snapshot_tag = self.private_storage.get( dest_share_instance['id'], 'migr_snapshot_tag') out, err = self.execute('ps', 'aux') if not '@%s' % snapshot_tag in out: dst_dataset_name = self.private_storage.get( dest_share_instance['id'], 'dataset_name') try: dst_executor = dest_driver_migration_info['executor'] self.execute( 'sudo', 'zfs', 'get', 'quota', dst_dataset_name, executor=dst_executor, ) # Apply access rules to new share instance self._get_share_helper( src_share_instance['share_proto']).update_access( dst_dataset_name, access_rules, add_rules=[], delete_rules=[], make_all_ro=False, executor=dst_executor) return True except exception.ProcessExecutionError as e: raise exception.ZFSonLinuxException(msg=_( 'Migration process is absent and dst dataset ' 'returned following error: %s') % e) @ensure_share_server_not_provided def migration_complete( self, context, src_share_instance, dest_host, dest_driver_migration_info, dest_share_instance, access_rules, share_server=None, dest_share_server=None): """Is called to perform 2nd phase of driver migration of a given share. """ dst_dataset_name = self.private_storage.get( dest_share_instance['id'], 'dataset_name') snapshot_tag = self.private_storage.get( dest_share_instance['id'], 'migr_snapshot_tag') dst_snapshot_name = ( '%(dataset_name)s@%(snapshot_tag)s' % { 'snapshot_tag': snapshot_tag, 'dataset_name': dst_dataset_name, } ) dst_executor = dest_driver_migration_info['executor'] # Destroy temporary migration snapshot on dst host self.execute( 'sudo', 'zfs', 'destroy', dst_snapshot_name, executor=dst_executor, ) # Get export locations of new share instance export_locations = self._get_share_helper( dest_share_instance['share_proto']).create_exports( dst_dataset_name, executor=dst_executor) # Destroy src share and temporary migration snapshot on src (this) host self.delete_share(context, src_share_instance) return export_locations @ensure_share_server_not_provided def migration_cancel( self, context, src_share_instance, dest_host, dest_driver_migration_info, dest_share_instance, share_server=None, dest_share_server=None): """Is called to cancel driver migration.""" src_dataset_name = self.private_storage.get( src_share_instance['id'], 'dataset_name') dst_dataset_name = self.private_storage.get( dest_share_instance['id'], 'dataset_name') ssh_cmd = self.private_storage.get( dest_share_instance['id'], 'ssh_cmd') snapshot_tag = self.private_storage.get( dest_share_instance['id'], 'migr_snapshot_tag') # Kill migration process try: migr_pid = self.private_storage.get( src_share_instance['id'], 'migr_pid') self.execute('sudo', 'kill', '-9', migr_pid) except exception.ProcessExecutionError as e: # Ignore screen session NotFound error LOG.debug("Caught following error trying to kill screen session " "for cancelled migration: %s", e) # Sleep couple of seconds before destroying updated objects time.sleep(2) # Destroy snapshot on source host self._delete_dataset_or_snapshot_with_retry( src_dataset_name + '@' + snapshot_tag) # Destroy dataset and its migration snapshot on destination host self.execute( 'ssh', ssh_cmd, 'sudo', 'zfs', 'destroy', '-r', dst_dataset_name, ) LOG.debug( "Migration of share with ID '%s' has been canceled." % src_share_instance["id"])
deleted_lines: 'ssh_cmd': ssh_cmd, # used in replication dataset_name + '@' + self.replica_snapshot_prefix)

subject: Add create_all and delete_all for AllocationList
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-30 21:20:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/9751f21cb36e3af562df27b34846b87707c4205b', 'message': "WIP Add create_all and delete_all to AllocationList

This is the object side of setting and deleting allocations in the
placement service.

This is not done, thus far the only thing implemented is create_all
and it doesn't handle all cases yet nor all paths tested, for
example updating an existing allocation (which was decided in IRC to
be something we did want)

The current form has things written out as calls to object methods.
It might make more sense for some of that to be a larger SQL
statement. In either case additional testing is required to make
sure that when things go wrong (for example there isn't enough
available inventory) the rollbacks happen correctly.

We also decided in IRC that it wasn't clear at this stage if/how
resource provider generations were to be worked in here: either the
write of the allocation works or it does not. If it turns out
generation are needed we can hork it in.

delete_all should be less complicated as we don't need to do any
checking before we kill stuff off.

More coming tomorrow.

Change-Id: Ic0bb48dcb1ab33b278f09dee8778fcb7a374caad
Partially-Implements: blueprint generic-resource-pools
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-31 10:54:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/ecdb9aa80d8c731dbc93cf00eb4bba789f72d558', 'message': "WIP Add create_all and delete_all to AllocationList

This is the object side of setting and deleting allocations in the
placement service.

This is not done, both create_all and delete_all are implemented
but it doesn't handle all cases yet nor all paths tested, for
example updating an existing allocation (which was decided in IRC to
be something we did want) doesn't update: it creates another one.
This is marked with a TODO and the associated test is commented out
with a XXX.

The current form has things written out as calls to object methods.
It might make more sense for some of that to be a larger SQL
statement. In either case additional testing is required to make
sure that when things go wrong (for example there isn't enough
available inventory) the rollbacks happen correctly.

We also decided in IRC that it wasn't clear at this stage if/how
resource provider generations were to be worked in here: either the
write of the allocation works or it does not. If it turns out
generation are needed we can hork it in. The associated IRC
conversation is near: http://p.anticdent.org/22rc

Despite this not being done, pushing it up so that the patch above
it can make progress while we work out the issues with updates and
the shape of the functionality provided here.

Change-Id: Ic0bb48dcb1ab33b278f09dee8778fcb7a374caad
Partially-Implements: blueprint generic-resource-pools
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-31 18:54:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/088c84d8b523c01e3fe7c85b14bf5e734a5d10b5', 'message': "WIP Add set_all and delete_all to AllocationList

This is the object side of setting and deleting allocations in the
placement service.

This is not done, both set_all and delete_all are implemented
but it doesn't handle all cases yet nor are all paths tested.

And it is done in a way that completely violates the layer boundary
being the database and the objects. It was done this way for
expediency and just to get the logic worked out. The hope is that we
can improve it from here (with the help of Jay most likely).

The current form has things written out as calls to object methods.
As stated above that would make more sense for some of that to be a
larger SQL statement. In either case additional testing is required
to make sure that when things go wrong (for example there isn't enough
available inventory) the rollbacks happen correctly.

The resource provider generation is checked but not incremented.
It's unclear whether we should be incrementing or just checking.

So much WIP.

Change-Id: Ic0bb48dcb1ab33b278f09dee8778fcb7a374caad
Partially-Implements: blueprint generic-resource-pools
"}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2016-08-31 22:13:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/eb2dccebde0e3a52f5fcc7823ff123676663f0b9', 'message': 'WIP create_all and delete_all for AllocationList

This is the object side of creating and deleting allocations in the
placement service.

create_all() checks that the inventory records involved in the
allocations requested do not have their capacities exceeded. If no
inventory capacities are exceeded, allocation records are written to the
database. Afterwards, the resource provider generation for each resource
provider involved in the allocation transaction has its generation
incremented. If another threads has concurrently updated either the
inventory or the usage of resources, this generation increment will
raise ConcurrentUpdateDetected, allowing callers to retry. This patch

commit_message:
Add create_all and delete_all for AllocationList

This is the object side of creating and deleting allocations in the
placement service.

create_all() checks that the inventory records involved in the
allocations requested do not have their capacities exceeded. If no
inventory capacities are exceeded, allocation records are written to the
database. Afterwards, the resource provider generation for each resource
provider involved in the allocation transaction has its generation
incremented. If another threads has concurrently updated either the
inventory or the usage of resources, this generation increment will
raise ConcurrentUpdateDetected, allowing callers to retry. This patch
does not yet implement this retry, which should be fine for the time
being considering that nothing yet calls POST /allocations.

Partially-Implements: blueprint generic-resource-pools

Co-Authored-By: Jay Pipes <jaypipes@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Ed Leafe <ed@leafe.com>

Change-Id: Ic0bb48dcb1ab33b278f09dee8778fcb7a374caad

added_lines: def test_allocations_by_resource_provider(self): rp1 = objects.ResourceProvider(uuid=uuids.rp1) rp2 = objects.ResourceProvider(uuid=uuids.rp2) allocation_objects = [ objects.Allocation(resource_provider=rp, used=2, consumer_uuid=uuids.consumer, resource_class=klass) for rp, klass in ( (rp1, 'DISK_GB'), (rp1, 'IPV4_ADDRESS'), (rp2, 'DISK_GB'))] by_rp = objects.AllocationList._by_resource_provider( allocation_objects) self.assertItemsEqual([rp1.uuid, rp2.uuid], by_rp.keys()) last_allocation = allocation_objects[2] by_rp_info = list(by_rp[rp2.uuid])[0] self.assertEqual(last_allocation.used, by_rp_info.used) rp1_info = list(by_rp[rp1.uuid]) self.assertEqual(2, len(rp1_info), 'There should be two allocations for rp1')

subject: Add support for allocations in placement API
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-09 02:20:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/791dda109e498f5372dc9f82d66ccc9a44ce6888', 'message': 'WIP Add support for allocations in placement API

A new endpoint supporting PUT and DELETE methods with a path
of /resource_providers/{uuid}/allocations/{consumer_id} calls
set_allocations and delete_allocations on the associated resource
provider to either set allocations for one or more resource classes
or delete all the allocations from the consumer on the resource
provider.

An example JSON body in PUT request takes the following form:

    "allocations": {
        "DISK_GB": 28,
        "VCPU": 2
    }

The body is validated against the JSON schema defined in the
ALLOCATION_SCHEMA constant.

NOTE: This doesn't work yet because the necessary methods on
the resource provider object do not work yet. When implemented
they will accept an AllocationList object as their argument and
use the same 'generataion an a comparison marker' concept
used in set_inventory().

Change-Id: Ic1e90636bad44b7dc76b45c5f93c67f3fe3297f7
Partially-Implements: blueprint generic-resource-pools

'}, {'number': 26, 'created': '2016-08-19 17:36:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/107e76385f8973cbda96fbea41281604722d54c9', 'message': 'WIP Add support for allocations in placement API

A new endpoint supporting PUT and DELETE methods with a path
of /allocations/{consumer_id} calls set_allocations and
delete_allocations to set or delete allocations for one or more
resource classes on one or more resource providers.

An example JSON body in PUT request takes the following form:

    {"allocations": [
      {
        "resource_provider": {
            "uuid": "d4b87fe1-30ca-4a65-8947-dfa3d85f10be"
        },
        "resources": {
            "MEMORY_MB": 64,
            "VCPU": 2
        }
      },
      {
        "resource_provider": {
            "uuid": "3cbe1001-bba9-4ef6-ae9c-feac1c3f9626"
        },
        "resources": {
            "DISK_GB": 28
        }
      }
    ]}

The body is validated against the JSON schema defined in the
ALLOCATION_SCHEMA constant.

NOTE: This doesn't work yet because the necessary methods on
the resource provider object do not work yet and the tests here
require the inventory part of the api to have merged.
When the methods are implemented they will use the same
'generation as a comparison marker' concept used in
ResourceProvider.set_inventory().

Change-Id: Ic1e90636bad44b7dc76b45c5f93c67f3fe3297f7
Partially-Implements: blueprint generic-resource-pools

            "VCPU": 2
        }
      },
      {
        "resource_provider": {
            "uuid": "3cbe1001-bba9-4ef6-ae9c-feac1c3f9626"
        },
        "resources": {
            "DISK_GB": 28
        }
      }
    ]}

The body is validated against the JSON schema defined in the
ALLOCATION_SCHEMA constant.

TODO: There is some confusion and indecision on what the right
behavior is with regard to:

* the use of generations
* updating existing allocations. Right now this doesn't work.
  A new allocation is created but that's not what we want. Changes
  are required in the patch below this one, and to do that we need
  to decide the behavior we are expecting.

Change-Id: Ic1e90636bad44b7dc76b45c5f93c67f3fe3297f7
Partially-Implements: blueprint generic-resource-pools

        },
        "resources": {

      }
    ]}

The body is validated against the JSON schema defined in the

behavior is with regard to:

* the use of generations
* updating existing allocations. Right now this doesn't work.
  A new allocation is created but that's not what we want. Changes
  are required in the patch below this one, and to do that we need

added_lines: # Tests of allocations API fixtures: - ConfigFixture defaults: request_headers: x-auth-token: admin accept: application/json tests: - name: get allocations no consumer is 404 GET: /resource_providers/$ENVIRON['RP_UUID']/allocations status: 404 - name: get allocations is 405 GET: /resource_providers/$ENVIRON['RP_UUID']/allocations/599ffd2d-526a-4b2e-8683-f13ad25f9958 status: 405 response_headers: allow: /(PUT, DELETE|DELETE, PUT)/ - name: put an allocation no resource provider PUT: /resource_providers/$ENVIRON['RP_UUID']/allocations/599ffd2d-526a-4b2e-8683-f13ad25f9958 request_headers: content-type: application/json data: allocations: DISK_GB: 10 status: 404 - name: create the resource provider POST: /resource_providers request_headers: content-type: application/json data: name: $ENVIRON['RP_NAME'] uuid: $ENVIRON['RP_UUID'] status: 201 - name: put an allocation no data PUT: /resource_providers/$ENVIRON['RP_UUID']/allocations/599ffd2d-526a-4b2e-8683-f13ad25f9958 request_headers: content-type: application/json status: 400 - name: put an allocation violate schema PUT: /resource_providers/$ENVIRON['RP_UUID']/allocations/599ffd2d-526a-4b2e-8683-f13ad25f9958 request_headers: content-type: application/json data: allocations: cows: 5 status: 400 # TODO(cdent): From here on tests are marked xfail because they # can't work yet: The required objects on ResourceProvider are not # implemented yet. - name: put an allocation no inventory xfail: true PUT: /resource_providers/$ENVIRON['RP_UUID']/allocations/599ffd2d-526a-4b2e-8683-f13ad25f9958 request_headers: content-type: application/json data: allocations: DISK_GB: 10 status: 409 - name: post some inventory POST: /resource_providers/$ENVIRON['RP_UUID']/inventories request_headers: content-type: application/json data: resource_class: DISK_GB total: 2048 min_unit: 10 max_unit: 1024 status: 201 - name: put an allocation xfail: true PUT: /resource_providers/$ENVIRON['RP_UUID']/allocations/599ffd2d-526a-4b2e-8683-f13ad25f9958 request_headers: content-type: application/json data: allocations: DISK_GB: 10 status: 204 - name: put allocation again and fail xfail: true PUT: /resource_providers/$ENVIRON['RP_UUID']/allocations/599ffd2d-526a-4b2e-8683-f13ad25f9958 request_headers: content-type: application/json data: allocations: DISK_GB: 10 status: 409 - name: delete allocation xfail: true DELETE: /resource_providers/$ENVIRON['RP_UUID']/allocations/599ffd2d-526a-4b2e-8683-f13ad25f9958 status: 204 - name: delete allocation again xfail: true DELETE: /resource_providers/$ENVIRON['RP_UUID']/allocations/599ffd2d-526a-4b2e-8683-f13ad25f9958 status: 404 - commit_message:
Mv pacemaker and firewall out of controller

This patch moves settings for pacemaker and the tripleo firewall
out of controller.yaml.

Related bug: #1604414

Change-Id: I0164717bfd79cdea3de8eb7a64771028bea201ac

in /etc/hosts file

commit_message:
Remove openstack/common/uuidutils.py

Using oslo_utils uuidutils instead openstack/common/uuidutils.py

Change-Id: I90d795b6519985a088bb4deb6d706725037b5bfa

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """ UUID related utilities and helper functions. """ import uuid def generate_uuid(): return str(uuid.uuid4()) def is_uuid_like(val): """Returns validation of a value as a UUID. For our purposes, a UUID is a canonical form string: aaaaaaaa-aaaa-aaaa-aaaa-aaaaaaaaaaaa """ try: return str(uuid.UUID(val)) == val except (TypeError, ValueError, AttributeError): return False

commit_message:
Pull from cell0 and build_requests for instance list

In order to list instances in the brave new world of cellsv2 we must
aggregate results from the build_requests table in the api cell, cell0,
and the single(atm) actual cell. Note that there are no plans to make
filtering/sorting a list of instances work across multiple cells.

Change-Id: I625c7714fb04eb2bf07695fd7ec053a2f32c62bc
Partially-implements: bp add-buildrequest-obj
Partially-implements: bp cells-scheduling-interaction
Depends-On: I090d5994c3077d86c60457e4c16a03d35e0c409c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/38/356138/20 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # The ordering of instances will be # [sorted instances with no host] + [sorted instances with host]. # This means BuildRequest and cell0 instances first, then cell # instances try: cell0_mapping = objects.CellMapping.get_by_uuid(context, objects.CellMapping.CELL0_UUID) except exception.CellMappingNotFound: cell0_instances = objects.InstanceList(objects=[]) else: with nova_context.target_cell(context, cell0_mapping): cell0_instances = self._get_instances_by_filters( context, filters, limit=limit, marker=marker, expected_attrs=expected_attrs, sort_keys=sort_keys, sort_dirs=sort_dirs) # Only subtract from limit if it is not None limit = (limit - len(cell0_instances)) if limit else limit # For now we only support one cell. if limit > 0: cell_instances = self._get_instances_by_filters(context, filters, limit=limit, marker=marker, expected_attrs=expected_attrs, sort_keys=sort_keys, sort_dirs=sort_dirs) else: cell_instances = objects.InstanceList(objects=[]) instances = objects.InstanceList( objects=cell0_instances.objects + cell_instances.objects)
deleted_lines: instances = self._get_instances_by_filters(context, filters, limit=limit, marker=marker, expected_attrs=expected_attrs, sort_keys=sort_keys, sort_dirs=sort_dirs)

commit_message:
[Dummy driver] Add share migration support

Add 'fake' share migration support to 'dummy' driver
for ease of interfaces testing.

Change-Id: Ifd444e38a9678e98c156b7ce658aa1b50c13b24c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/53/347853/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - Share migration self.migration_progress = {} def migration_check_compatibility( self, context, share_ref, dest_host, dest_driver_migration_info, share_server=None): """Is called to test compatibility with destination backend.""" return self.configuration.share_driver == ( dest_driver_migration_info.get("share_driver")) def migration_start( self, context, share_ref, dest_host, dest_driver_migration_info, migrating_share_ref, notify, access_rules, share_server=None, dest_share_server=None): """Is called to perform 1st phase of driver migration of a given share. """ LOG.debug( "Migration of dummy share with ID '%s' has been started." % share_ref["id"]) return False, {} def migration_complete( self, context, share_ref, dest_host, dest_driver_migration_info, migrating_share_ref, access_rules, share_server=None, dest_share_server=None): """Is called to perform 2nd phase of driver migration of a given share. """ share_name = self._get_share_name(share_ref) mountpoint = "/path/to/fake/share/%s" % share_name self.private_storage.update( share_ref["id"], { "fake_provider_share_name": share_name, "fake_provider_location": mountpoint, } ) LOG.debug( "Migration of dummy share with ID '%s' has been completed." % share_ref["id"]) return self._generate_export_locations( mountpoint, share_server=share_server) def migration_cancel( self, context, share_ref, dest_host, dest_driver_migration_info, migrating_share_ref, share_server=None, dest_share_server=None): """Is called to cancel driver migration.""" LOG.debug( "Migration of dummy share with ID '%s' has been canceled." % share_ref["id"]) def migration_get_progress( self, context, share_ref, dest_host, dest_driver_migration_info, migrating_share_ref, share_server=None, dest_share_server=None): """Is called to get migration progress.""" # Simulate migration progress. if share_ref["id"] not in self.migration_progress: self.migration_progress[share_ref["id"]] = total_progress = 25 elif self.migration_progress[share_ref["id"]] == 100: total_progress = self.migration_progress.pop(share_ref["id"]) else: self.migration_progress[share_ref["id"]] += 25 total_progress = self.migration_progress[share_ref["id"]] LOG.debug( ("Progress of current dummy share migration " "with ID '%(id)s' is %(progress).") % { "id": share_ref["id"], "progress": total_progress}) return {"total_progress": total_progress} def migration_get_driver_info(self, context, share, dest_host, share_server=None): """Is called to provide necessary driver migration logic.""" return {"share_driver": self.configuration.share_driver}

commit_message:
Remove hacked test that fails with latest os-brick

The test here was slated for removal long ago when we
integrated os-brick since it had to be hacked to mock
out some internals of os-brick, which is terrible and
has finally come home to break this unit test with
os-brick 1.6.1, so let's just remove it.

Change-Id: If11d6b078199878f9074e6b87f56c6f76087bfd3
Related-Bug: #1618697
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/54/364454/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: # TODO(mriedem): move this to os-brick def test_sanitize_log_run_iscsiadm(self): # Tests that the parameters to the os-brick connector's # _run_iscsiadm function are sanitized for passwords when logged. def fake_debug(*args, **kwargs): self.assertIn('node.session.auth.password', args[0]) self.assertNotIn('scrubme', args[0]) def fake_execute(*args, **kwargs): return (None, None) libvirt_driver = iscsi.LibvirtISCSIVolumeDriver(self.fake_conn) libvirt_driver.connector.set_execute(fake_execute) connection_info = self.iscsi_connection(self.vol, self.location, self.iqn) iscsi_properties = connection_info['data'] with mock.patch.object(connector.LOG, 'debug', side_effect=fake_debug) as debug_mock: libvirt_driver.connector._iscsiadm_update( iscsi_properties, 'node.session.auth.password', 'scrubme') # we don't care what the log message is, we just want to make sure # our stub method is called which asserts the password is scrubbed self.assertTrue(debug_mock.called)

commit_message:
Use heat devstack plugin

Now that heat is available as a devstack plugin, we should use it.
In-tree devstack code for heat is planned to be removed soon[1].

[1]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/317618/

Change-Id: I1184aae22667b8d06f060b1846567d1165ad9dbb

commit_message:
Update the requir version of os-brick

the patch I5b6eba7e5da54cb386bf597bf100db106c7a1b06 used
"encryptors" in os-brick which is introdued since 1.4.0.

Update the requirment to avoid the import error.

Change-Id: Iabc5adb35499d1ad0d84e13cc0a62870477f8141

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-31 14:01:55.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/conf.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-saharaclient/commit/fe007f0552d208b9b9d9594097177c8c4a1cd26c', 'message': 'Fix doc build if git is absent

When building packages if git is absent, then we should not set
html_last_updated_fmt. It can still be set via the -D switch
when building with sphinx-build.

Change-Id: Ie6477df7f65e5035b1b03b51f698972ce9dd9aaa
Closes-Bug: #1552251
'}]
commit_message:
Fix doc build if git is absent

When building packages if git is absent, then we should not set
html_last_updated_fmt. It can still be set via the -D switch
when building with sphinx-build.

Change-Id: Ie6477df7f65e5035b1b03b51f698972ce9dd9aaa
Closes-Bug: #1552251
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-saharaclient refs/changes/81/363681/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import warningstry: html_last_updated_fmt = subprocess.Popen( git_cmd, stdout=subprocess.PIPE).communicate()[0] except Exception: warnings.warn('Cannot get last updated time from git repository. ' 'Not setting "html_last_updated_fmt".')

commit_message:
Report compute node inventories through placement

This makes the scheduler client report compute node resource
inventories via the placement API if possible.

Related to blueprint generic-resource-pools

Co-Authored-By: Sylvain Bauza <sbauza@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ic1d0d15413e31a622dcca9ceaf588e805ac4aaba
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/61/363061/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _compute_node_inventory(self, compute_node): inventories = [ {'resource_class': 'VCPU', 'total': compute_node.vcpus, 'reserved': 0, 'min_unit': 1, 'max_unit': 1, 'step_size': 1, 'allocation_ratio': compute_node.cpu_allocation_ratio}, {'resource_class': 'MEMORY_MB', 'total': compute_node.memory_mb, 'reserved': 0, 'min_unit': 1, 'max_unit': 1, 'step_size': 1, 'allocation_ratio': compute_node.ram_allocation_ratio}, {'resource_class': 'DISK_GB', 'total': compute_node.local_gb, 'reserved': 0, 'min_unit': 1, 'max_unit': 1, 'step_size': 1, 'allocation_ratio': compute_node.disk_allocation_ratio}, ] generation = self._resource_providers[compute_node.uuid]['generation'] generation += 1 data = { 'resource_provider_generation': generation, 'inventories': inventories, } return data def _update_inventory(self, compute_node): url = '/resource_providers/%s/inventories' % compute_node.uuid data = self._compute_node_inventory(compute_node) result = self.post(url, data) if not result: LOG.error('Failed to update inventory for %s at generation %i' % ( compute_node.uuid, generation)) return elif result.status_code == 409: # Generation fail, re-poll and then re-try del self._resource_providers[compute_node.uuid] self._ensure_resource_provider( compute_node.uuid, compute_node.hypervisor_hostname) LOG.info('Retrying update inventory for %s' % ( compute_node.uuid)) # Regenerate the post with the new generation data = self._compute_node_inventory(compute_node) result = self.post(url, data) generation = data['resource_provider_generation'] if result.status_code == 200: self._resource_providers[compute_node.uuid]['generation'] = \ generation LOG.debug('Updated inventory for %s at generation %i' % ( compute_node.uuid, generation)) return result.json() else: LOG.error(_LE('Failed to update inventory for %s ' 'at generation %i: %s') % (compute_node.uuid, generation, result.reason)) self._update_inventory(compute_node)

commit_message:
Adds support for ambari-local option

This adds a feature to allow the user to include the HDP
repositories within the image. This is useful in helping speed up
the deployment process of Ambari based cluster deployments. Including
the repositories locally also reduces the need for a local webserver to host
the repositories.

Change-Id: I7982acc5365e30703b9f239f0dff9e76d2b4c0e6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara-image-elements refs/changes/59/339959/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: echo " [-p vanilla|spark|cloudera|storm|mapr|ambari|plain|ambari-local]" "ambari-local") case "$BASE_IMAGE_OS" in "" | "centos" | "centos7");; *) echo -e "'$BASE_IMAGE_OS' image type is not supported by '$PLUGIN'.\nAborting" exit 1 ;; esac if [ -n "$HADOOP_VERSION" ]; then echo -e "You shouldn't specify hadoop version for '$PLUGIN'.\nAborting" exit 1 fi ;; ####################### # Ambari-local images # ####################### if [ -z "$PLUGIN" -o "$PLUGIN" = "ambari-local" ]; then # generate Ambari-local for deploying Ambari from a local mirror common_elements="ssh" centos_elements_sequence="$common_elements disable-firewall disable-selinux hdp-local-mirror ambari $JAVA_ELEMENT swift_hadoop" centos7_elements_sequence="$common_elements disable-firewall disable-selinux hdp-local-mirror ambari $JAVA_ELEMENT swift_hadoop" export DIB_AMBARI_VERSION="$HADOOP_VERSION" export plugin_type="ambari" # set the temporary folder for hadoop-openstack.jar file export DIB_HDFS_LIB_DIR="/opt" if [ -z "$BASE_IMAGE_OS" -o "$BASE_IMAGE_OS" = "centos" ]; then ambari_local_image_name=${plain_centos_image_name:-centos_ambari_local} image_create centos $ambari_local_image_name $centos_elements_sequence fi if [ -z "$BASE_IMAGE_OS" -o "$BASE_IMAGE_OS" = "centos7" ]; then ambari_local_image_name=${plain_centos7_image_name:-centos7_ambari_local} image_create centos7 $ambari_local_image_name $centos7_elements_sequence fi unset DIB_HDFS_LIB_DIR unset plugin_type unset DIB_AMBARI_VERSION fi

commit_message:
Change CloudName default value to include domain

The CloudName's default value only included the shortname which is
not a very good practice. This now sets localdomain as the default
domain there.

Change-Id: Ic46b34d94a602aa948b873062015286cf49f7c3c

commit_message:
Return 400 error for non-existing snapshot_id

If you pass non-existing snapshot_id to the boot server api,
it returns HTTP 500 error.
This patch fixes this issue by catching SnapshotNotFound
exception and raising HTTPBadRequest in controller.

Closes-Bug: #1614097
Change-Id: Ieea5b4815e9078f9c22069a6fb772cd67b8de3a2

commit_message:
Delete BuildRequest regardless of service_version

Because an instance list will attempt to pull instances from the
build_requests table we should delete the BuildRequest when attempting
to delete an instance no matter what the minimum service version is.
However the deletion only affects the rest of the delete logic if the
service version is at a certain level.

Change-Id: I0637be3b9357de0f0f8fa2e7bae00859ccbe18e1

commit_message:
Fix service version lookups

There is some cellsv2 code that's conditional upon the nova-api services
all being above a specific service version. However the lookup was
checking for the 'nova-api' service version which returns the default of
0 because the actual registered service is 'nova-os_compute'.

Change-Id: I97a5d8472cc09ae64203de1c91d0db6ec59d83de
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/88/363888/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Switch order for cleanup in NamespaceFixture

In case ensure_namespace fails for any reason, the ip_wrapper attribute
is not created but destroy(), that uses this attribute, is still called.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I4135f6564a180b4bd275312866d3dc6e4b9b63ca

commit_message:
Support Senlin Resource with Scaling Capability

Change-Id: I96f52604571ea15527117c96d8cb4972854ee9d3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat-translator refs/changes/82/343482/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from collections import OrderedDictSECTIONS = (TYPE, PROPERTIES, METADATA, DEPENDS_ON, UPDATE_POLICY, DELETION_POLICY) = \ ('type', 'properties', 'metadata', 'depends_on', 'update_policy', 'deletion_policy')HOT_CLUSTER_TYPE = (SENLIN_CLUSTER, SENLIN_PROFILE) = \ ('OS::Senlin::Cluster', 'OS::Senlin::Profile') TOSCA_TO_HOT_CLUSTER = {'min_instances': 'min_size', 'max_instances': 'max_size', 'default_instances': 'desired_capacity'} TOSCA_LINKS_TO = 'tosca.relationships.network.LinksTo' COMPUTE_SCALABLE_PROP = (MIN_INSTANCES, MAX_INSTANCES, DEFAULT_INSTANCES) = \ ('min_instances', 'max_instances', 'default_instances') def _generate_cluster_networks_for_compute(self, network_name): networks = [] networks.append({'network': '%s' % network_name}) return networks def _get_cluster_scalable_properties(self, scalable_capability): scalable_cap_props = {} for prop in scalable_capability.get_properties_objects(): scalable_cap_props[TOSCA_TO_HOT_CLUSTER[prop.name]] = prop.value prof_name = '{get_resource: %s}' % self.name scalable_cap_props['profile'] = prof_name return scalable_cap_props def _get_cluster_dict_output(self): resource_sections = OrderedDict() resource_sections[TYPE] = SENLIN_CLUSTER cluster_properties = self._get_cluster_scalable_properties( self.nodetemplate.get_capability('scalable')) if cluster_properties: resource_sections[PROPERTIES] = cluster_properties return resource_sections links_to = None for rel, node in self.nodetemplate.relationships.items(): # Check for LinksTo relations. If found add a network property with # the network name into the compute if not links_to and rel.is_derived_from(TOSCA_LINKS_TO): links_to = node network_resource = None for hot_resource in self.depends_on_nodes: if links_to.name == hot_resource.name: network_resource = hot_resource self.depends_on.remove(hot_resource) break if network_resource.existing_resource_id: networks = self._generate_cluster_networks_for_compute( network_resource.existing_resource_id) self.properties['networks'] = networks def get_dict_output(self): '''Override get_dict_output to support Senlin resource.''' if self.nodetemplate.get_capability('scalable'): resource_sections = OrderedDict() cluster_sections = OrderedDict() resource_sections[TYPE] = SENLIN_PROFILE if self.properties: cluster_sections[TYPE] = "os.nova.server-1.0" del self.properties["user_data_format"] cluster_sections[PROPERTIES] = self.properties resource_sections[PROPERTIES] = cluster_sections if self.metadata: resource_sections[METADATA] = self.metadata if self.depends_on: resource_sections[DEPENDS_ON] = [] for depend in self.depends_on: resource_sections[DEPENDS_ON].append(depend.name) if self.update_policy: resource_sections[UPDATE_POLICY] = self.update_policy if self.deletion_policy: resource_sections[DELETION_POLICY] = self.deletion_policy cluster_resource = self._get_cluster_dict_output() cluster_name = 'cluster-%s' % self.name return {self.name: resource_sections, cluster_name: cluster_resource} else: return super(ToscaCompute, self).get_dict_output()

added_lines: This chapter documents :command:`swift` version ``3.1.0``. usage: swift [--version] [--help] [--os-help] [--snet] [--verbose] [--os-cert <client-certificate-file>] [--os-key <client-certificate-key-file>]``copy`` Copies object, optionally adds meta swift download --help swift -A https://auth.api.rackspacecloud.com/v1.0 \ -U user -K api_key stat -v swift --os-auth-url https://api.example.com/v2.0 \ --os-tenant-name tenant \ --os-username user --os-password password list swift --os-auth-url https://api.example.com/v3 --auth-version 3\ --os-project-name project1 --os-project-domain-name domain1 \ --os-username user --os-user-domain-name domain1 \ --os-password password list swift --os-auth-url https://api.example.com/v3 --auth-version 3\ --os-project-id 0123456789abcdef0123456789abcdef \ --os-user-id abcdef0123456789abcdef0123456789 \ --os-password password list swift --os-auth-token 6ee5eb33efad4e45ab46806eac010566 \ --os-storage-url https://10.1.5.2:8080/v1/AUTH_ced809b6a4baea7aeab61a \ list swift list --lh``-A=AUTH, --auth=AUTH URL`` for obtaining an auth token. ``-V=AUTH_VERSION, --auth-version=AUTH_VERSION, --os-identity-api-version=AUTH_VERSION````-U=USER, --user=USER````-K=KEY, --key=KEY````-R=RETRIES, --retries=RETRIES``.. _swift_auth: swift auth ---------- .. code-block:: console Usage: swift auth Display auth related authentication variables in shell friendly format. Commands to run to export storage url and auth token into OS_STORAGE_URL and OS_AUTH_TOKEN: swift auth Commands to append to a runcom file (e.g. ~/.bashrc, /etc/profile) for automatic authentication: swift auth -v -U test:tester -K testing -A http://localhost:8080/auth/v1.0 Usage: swift capabilitiesOptional positional arguments: <proxy_url> Proxy URL of the cluster to retrieve capabilities. **Optional arguments:** ``--json`` Print the cluster capabilities in JSON format.Usage: swift deleteUsage: swift download``-m, --marker <marker>`` Example: :option:`--header` "content-type:text/plain"``--ignore-checksum`` Turn off checksum validation for downloads. reduce the load on individual drives when multipleUsage: swift listUsage: swift post .r:\*, .r:-.example.com, .r:www.example.com, account1, account2:user2Usage: swift statUsage: swift tempurlUsage: swift upload Uploads specified files and directories to the given container. repeated. Example: -H "content-type:text/plain"
deleted_lines: This chapter documents :command:`swift` version ``3.0.0``. Usage: swift [--version] [--help] [--os-help] [--snet] [--verbose] swift download --help swift -A https://auth.api.rackspacecloud.com/v1.0 -U user -K api_key stat -v swift --os-auth-url https://api.example.com/v2.0 --os-tenant-name tenant \ --os-username user --os-password password list swift --os-auth-url https://api.example.com/v3 --auth-version 3\ --os-project-name project1 --os-project-domain-name domain1 \ --os-username user --os-user-domain-name domain1 \ --os-password password list swift --os-auth-url https://api.example.com/v3 --auth-version 3\ --os-project-id 0123456789abcdef0123456789abcdef \ --os-user-id abcdef0123456789abcdef0123456789 \ --os-password password list swift --os-auth-token 6ee5eb33efad4e45ab46806eac010566 \ --os-storage-url https://10.1.5.2:8080/v1/AUTH_ced809b6a4baea7aeab61a \ list swift list --lh show this help message and exit``-A AUTH, --auth=AUTH`` URL for obtaining an auth token. ``-V AUTH_VERSION,`` ``--auth-version=AUTH_VERSION,`` ``--os-identity-api-version=AUTH_VERSION````-U USER, --user=USER````-K KEY, --key=KEY````-R RETRIES, --retries=RETRIES`` Usage: swift capabilities **Optional positional arguments:** ``<proxy_url>`` Proxy URL of the cluster to retrieve capabilities. Usage: swift delete Usage: swift download``-m, --marker`` Example :option:`--header` "content-type:text/plain" to reduce the load on individual drives when multiple Usage: swift list Usage: swift post ``.r:*``, ``.r:-.example.com``, ``.r:www.example.com``, ``account1``, ``account2:user2`` Usage: swift stat Usage: swift tempurl Usage: swift upload Uploads specified files and directories to the given container. repeated. Example -H "content-type:text/plain".. _swift_auth: swift auth ---------- .. code-block:: console Usage: swift auth Display auth related authentication variables in shell friendly format. Commands to run to export storage url and auth token into ``OS_STORAGE_URL`` and ``OS_AUTH_TOKEN``: .. code-block:: console $ swift auth Commands to append to a runcom file (e.g. ``~/.bashrc``, ``/etc/profile``) for automatic authentication: .. code-block:: console $ swift auth -v -U test:tester -K testing -A http://localhost:8080/auth/v1.0

subject: Non-destructive upgrade for deprecated resources
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-15 13:06:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/a0058384e020367bfa5c2fc1b29660d38017b6d8', 'message': 'Non-destructive upgrade for deprecated resources

If you attempt to update a stack containing
OS::Heat::SoftwareDeployments resources, so it uses the new
non-deprecated OS::Heat::SoftwareDeploymentGroup type instead, it
deletes the group, and all of the deployments.

This means that any deployment "actions" property will be
misinterpreted, e.g if you have actions: CREATE, all the deployments
will re-run on the update, even though it's an update, not a create.

This issue exists on all deprecated resoruces, when we trying to upgrade
to new version of it by update.

This patch fix above update issue by check if resoruce was deprecated
and been update by replacing resource (which is the parent class of
existing resource).

Change-Id: Ib7880120a90c4497a7ceea53eee55c220a28d14e
Closes-Bug: #bug/1528958
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-18 05:24:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/43ac149866ca0892c80f818dc492bffa0865fa90', 'message': 'Non-destructive upgrade for deprecated resources

commit_message:
Non-destructive upgrade for deprecated resources

If you attempt to update a stack containing
OS::Heat::SoftwareDeployments resources, so it uses the new
non-deprecated OS::Heat::SoftwareDeploymentGroup type instead, it
deletes the group, and all of the deployments.

This means that any deployment "actions" property will be
misinterpreted, e.g if you have actions: CREATE, all the deployments
will re-run on the update, even though it's an update, not a create.

This issue exists on all deprecated resoruces, when we trying to upgrade
to new version of it by update.

This patch fix above update issue by check if resoruce was deprecated
and been update by replacing resource (which is the parent class of
existing resource).

Change-Id: Ib7880120a90c4497a7ceea53eee55c220a28d14e
Closes-Bug: #1528958

added_lines: def _delete_object(self): @scheduler.wrappertask def destroy(self): """A task to delete the resource and remove it from the database.""" yield self.delete() if self.id is None: return self._delete_object()
deleted_lines: @scheduler.wrappertask def destroy(self): """A task to delete the resource and remove it from the database.""" yield self.delete() if self.id is None: return

subject: Add binding_index to RouterL3AgentBinding
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-01 12:43:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/010623626cfeacf16e8aa941fc504ce1d33bcd49', 'message': 'Add binding_index to RouterL3AgentBinding

The patch proposes adding a new binding_index to the
RouterL3AgentBinding table, with an additional Unique Constraint that
enforces a single <router_id, binding_id> per router. This goes a long
way into fixing 2 issues:

1. When scheduling a non-HA router, we only use binding_index=1. This
   means that only a single row containing that router_id can be
   committed into the database. This in fact prevents over-scheduling of
   non-HA routers. Note that for the HA router case, the binding_index
   is simply copied from the L3HARouterAgentPortBinding (since they are
   always created together they should always match).

2. This sets the ground-work for a refactor of the l3 scheduler - by
   using this binding and db-based limitation, we can schedule a router
   to agents using the RouterL3AgentBinding, while postponing the
   creation of L3HARouterAgentPortBinding objects for the agents until
   they ask for it (using sync_routers). This will be a major
   improvement over todays "everything can create
   L3HARouterAgentPortBinding" way of things).

Closes-Bug: #1535557
Change-Id: I3447ea5bcb7c57365c6f50efe12a1671e86588b3
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-01 19:52:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/95c3839d31208bb25bc8c71d7e66b22e516bc330', 'message': 'Add binding_index to RouterL3AgentBinding

   using this binding and db-based limitation, we can schedule a router
   to agents using the RouterL3AgentBinding, while postponing the
   creation of L3HARouterAgentPortBinding objects for the agents until
   they ask for it (using sync_routers). This will be a major
   improvement over todays "everything can create
   L3HARouterAgentPortBinding" way of things).

Closes-Bug: #1535557
Change-Id: I3447ea5bcb7c57365c6f50efe12a1671e86588b3

commit_message:
Add binding_index to RouterL3AgentBinding

The patch proposes adding a new binding_index to the
RouterL3AgentBinding table, with an additional Unique Constraint that
enforces a single <router_id, binding_id> per router. This goes a long
way into fixing 2 issues:

1. When scheduling a non-HA router, we only use binding_index=1. This
   means that only a single row containing that router_id can be
   committed into the database. This in fact prevents over-scheduling of
   non-HA routers. Note that for the HA router case, the binding_index
   is simply copied from the L3HARouterAgentPortBinding (since they are
   always created together they should always match).

2. This sets the ground-work for a refactor of the l3 scheduler - by
   using this binding and db-based limitation, we can schedule a router
   to agents using the RouterL3AgentBinding, while postponing the
   creation of L3HARouterAgentPortBinding objects for the agents until
   they ask for it (using sync_routers). This will be a major
   improvement over todays "everything can create
   L3HARouterAgentPortBinding" way of things).

Closes-Bug: #1535557
Change-Id: I3447ea5bcb7c57365c6f50efe12a1671e86588b3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/78/364278/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2016 OpenStack Foundation # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # """Add binding index to RouterL3AgentBinding Revision ID: 2e0d7a8a1586 Revises: ea8d1c569973 Create Date: 2016-09-01 14:01:57.263289 """ # revision identifiers, used by Alembic. revision = '2e0d7a8a1586' down_revision = 'ea8d1c569973' from collections import defaultdict from alembic import op import sqlalchemy as sa ROUTER_L3_AGENT_BINDING = 'routerl3agentbindings' def contract_creation_exceptions(): """Add a new binding_index to ensure that no over-creation of the bindings is possible. """ return { sa.Column: ['%s.binding_index' % ROUTER_L3_AGENT_BINDING] } def upgrade(): op.add_column(ROUTER_L3_AGENT_BINDING, sa.Column('binding_index', sa.Integer(), nullable=False, server_default='0')) bindings_table = sa.Table( ROUTER_L3_AGENT_BINDING, sa.MetaData(), sa.Column('router_id', sa.String(36)), sa.Column('l3_agent_id', sa.String(36)), sa.Column('binding_index', sa.Integer, nullable=False, server_default='0'), ) routers_to_bindings = defaultdict(list) session = sa.orm.Session(bind=op.get_bind()) with session.begin(subtransactions=True): for result in session.query(bindings_table): routers_to_bindings[result.router_id].append(result) for bindings in routers_to_bindings.values(): for index, result in enumerate(bindings): session.execute(bindings_table.update().values( binding_index=index).where( bindings_table.c.router_id == result.router_id).where( bindings_table.c.l3_agent_id == result.l3_agent_id)) session.commit() op.create_unique_constraint( 'uniq_router_l3_agent_binding0router_id0binding_index0', ROUTER_L3_AGENT_BINDING, ['router_id', 'binding_index'])

commit_message:
Remove left over conf placeholders

Lots of placeholders were added into conf/__init.py__ to reduce the
number of merge conflicts during the configuration refactoring. Now the
moves have been completed, we can remove the placeholders that were
never actually used.

blueprint centralize-config-options-newton

Change-Id: Ie207d6dbd5806c1e8b8937153ae9d74e147b1a11

commit_message:
Improve consistency in WSGI opts

* Updated header flags
* Moved all vars to list
* Removed possible values sections where they were not needed

subject: Add share type change to Share Migration
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-21 03:21:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/commit/cc62fc8f436ed1a4f2b33ed427e8400ea82e91ea', 'message': "Add share type change to Share Migration

This patch adds a 'new_share_type_id' parameter to Share Migration,
where the destination share can be provisioned under a different
share type of choice.

Fallback migration handles it by creating a totally new share,
as before.

Driver-optimized migration handles by creating the destination
instance model with the new share type, the driver is responsible
for making the necessary changes to satisfy the provided model.

In order to accomplish this, a database change was required,
transferring the 'share_type_id' field from the 'shares' table
to the 'share_instances' table.

TODO:
- Add 'share_type_id' field to share_instances
get/list/show/detail API.

Change-Id: I3200eaaa5b66d9b8ce1cbd16c1658db8516c70fb

"}, {'number': 11, 'created': '2016-07-22 12:38:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/commit/899871333eccb478f4f53aeb45511d64aed280b7', 'message': "Add share type change to Share Migration

This patch adds a 'new_share_type_id' parameter to Share Migration,
where the destination share can be provisioned under a different
share type of choice.

Fallback migration handles it by creating a totally new share,
as before.

Driver-optimized migration handles by creating the destination
instance model with the new share type, the driver is responsible
for making the necessary changes to satisfy the provided model.

In order to accomplish this, a database change was required,
transferring the 'share_type_id' field from the 'shares' table
to the 'share_instances' table.

Partially implements: blueprint newton-migration-improvements
Change-Id: I3200eaaa5b66d9b8ce1cbd16c1658db8516c70fb

commit_message:
Add share type change to Share Migration

This patch adds a 'new_share_type_id' parameter to Share Migration,
where the destination share can be provisioned under a different
share type of choice.

Host-assisted migration handles it by creating a totally new share,
as before.

Driver-assisted migration handles by creating the destination
instance model with the new share type, the driver is responsible
for making the necessary changes to satisfy the provided model.

In order to accomplish this, a database change was required,
transferring the 'share_type_id' field from the 'shares' table
to the 'share_instances' table.

APIImpact

Partially implements: blueprint newton-migration-improvements
Change-Id: I3200eaaa5b66d9b8ce1cbd16c1658db8516c70fb

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-08 08:30:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/fc93221c40ca468c8f9a6a121187dc5da6935913', 'message': "WIP Get cell service version for compute RPC calls

This is an initial attempt at querying service version from a
cell database in order to make compute RPC calls. Different
cells may have different version caps.

This looks up the CellMapping for an instance or host in order
to cache service version based on cell uuid. Otherwise, the
CellMapping isn't really needed as the database connection
information can be assumed to be present in the context if
a cell is being targeted. The problem with no CellMapping in
that case is we would have to find some way to key the cache
of service versions.

As a side effect, this also explores the possibility of
containing target_cell calls to the RPC API layer. Otherwise,
we have to get target_cell for a variety of API calls in the
API layer.

Change-Id: I96849888087f4b09433cb683a9eb4719d1c35c4c

This is an initial attempt at querying service version from a

This looks up the CellMapping for an instance or host in order
to cache service version based on cell uuid. Otherwise, the
CellMapping isn't really needed as the database connection
information can be assumed to be present in the context if
a cell is being targeted. The problem with no CellMapping in
that case is we would have to find some way to key the cache

"}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2016-08-10 01:03:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/1049a0ab5e1034da9036240bcd07db48144ea148', 'message': "Move cell message queue switching and add caching

This moves the cell message queue switching code from the
RequestContext to the RPC layer where it's ultimately used.
Originally, it was thought that a separate DB query for
a CellMapping would occur per compute RPC API call in the
API cell and the context manager would be invoked to inject
the cell message queue transport to use for the RPC call.

Since compute RPC calls are based on the CellMapping of an
instance or a host, we could instead have generic functions
that take an instance or host and look up InstanceMapping or
HostMapping to get the CellMapping and return the
corresponding RPC client.

The RPC client objects are cached by CellMapping uuid and
expired clients are removed using a periodic task.

Co-Authored-By: Brian Elliott <bdelliott@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I96849888087f4b09433cb683a9eb4719d1c35c4c

commit_message:
Move cell message queue switching and add caching

This moves the cell message queue switching code from the
RequestContext to the RPC layer where it's ultimately used.
Originally, it was thought that a separate DB query for
a CellMapping would occur per compute RPC API call in the
API cell and the context manager would be invoked to inject
the cell message queue transport to use for the RPC call.

Since compute RPC calls are based on the CellMapping of an
instance or a host, we could instead have generic functions
that take an instance or host and look up InstanceMapping or
HostMapping to get the CellMapping and return the
corresponding RPC client.

The RPC client objects are cached by CellMapping uuid and
expired clients are removed using a periodic task.

Co-Authored-By: Brian Elliott <bdelliott@gmail.com>

Depends-On: I6f211e9102f79418f9f94a15784f91c4150ab8a7

Change-Id: I96849888087f4b09433cb683a9eb4719d1c35c4c

commit_message:
more bug work around of Moxy bug of 475475

subnet has segment_id, subnetpool_id which can be null.
https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=475475

This is a bug workardoun as
https://bugs.opendaylight.org/show_bug.cgi?id=6619

Change-Id: Ifdb2d0300159e01b21d801bb08bc03661ab77b95

commit_message:
Add basic logging to placement api

This adds basic logging to the placement API so that we can see the
request flow, including errors.

Change-Id: I09a2ba42ab1d37037a8a2f61be8ef597740b1593

commit_message:
Windows SMB: implement 'update_access' method

This change implements the 'update_access' method within the Windows
SMB driver with respect to the semantics specified in the base driver.

The 'allow_access' and 'deny_access' methods are now removed.

Closes-Bug: #1618556

Change-Id: I2b52c48331a2c94ec4dcf34779cac5d1b73a121b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/55/354855/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: from manila.common import constants as const from manila import exception @ddt.data(const.ACCESS_LEVEL_RW, const.ACCESS_LEVEL_RO) def test_allow_access(self, access_level): access = { 'access_type': 'ip', 'access_to': 'fake_dest', 'access_level': access_level, } self._drv.allow_access( mock.sentinel.context, self._share, access, share_server=self._share_server) self._smb_helper.allow_access.assert_called_once_with( self._share_server['backend_details'], self._share['name'], access['access_type'], access['access_level'], access['access_to']) def test_allow_access_unsupported(self): access = { 'access_type': 'ip', 'access_to': 'fake_dest', 'access_level': 'fakefoobar', } self.assertRaises( exception.InvalidShareAccessLevel, self._drv.allow_access, mock.sentinel.context, self._share, access, share_server=self._share_server) def test_deny_access(self): access = 'fake_access' self._drv.deny_access( mock.sentinel.context, self._share, access, share_server=self._share_server) self._smb_helper.deny_access.assert_called_once_with( self._share_server['backend_details'], self._share['name'], access)

commit_message:
Merge duplicated renos of identity-clients

Before releasing Tempest 12.2.0, we found the duplicated renos on
http://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/tempest/unreleased.html
That seems unreadable for users, so let's merge them into a single.

Change-Id: Id51ecebcbf56c5e0f62e3bd35e7d531f411904db

added_lines: This chapter documents :command:`ironic` version ``1.7.0``.``create`` Create baremetal resources (chassis, nodes, and ports). .. _ironic_create: ironic create ------------- .. code-block:: console usage: ironic create <file> [<file> ...] Create baremetal resources (chassis, nodes, and ports). The resources may be described in one or more JSON or YAML files. If any file cannot be validated, no resources are created. An attempt is made to create all the resources; those that could not be created are skipped (with a corresponding error message). **Positional arguments:** ``<file>`` File (.yaml or .json) containing descriptions of the resources to create. Can be specified multiple times. Unregister node(s) from the Ironic service. Returns errors for any nodes that could not be unregistered. [--wait [WAIT_TIMEOUT]] Supported states: 'deleted', 'provide', 'clean', 'manage', 'active', 'rebuild', 'inspect', 'abort',``--wait [WAIT_TIMEOUT]`` Wait for a node to reach the expected state. Not supported for 'abort'. Optionally takes a timeout in seconds. The default value is 0, meaning no timeout. Fails if the node reaches an unexpected stable state, a failure state or a state with last_error set.

[cli-ref] Update python-senlinclient to 1.0.0

Change-Id: I653e123cd8103044b68e78592bab11fc44ffe7b1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/86/364686/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: This chapter documents :command:`senlin` version ``1.0.0``. [--profile HMAC_KEY]``cluster-collect`` Collect attributes across a cluster. ``cluster-run`` Run shell scripts on all nodes of a cluster. ``policy-validate`` VAlidate a policy spec. ``profile-validate`` Validate a profile. .. _senlin_cluster-collect: senlin cluster-collect ---------------------- .. code-block:: console usage: senlin cluster-collect [-p <PATH>] [-L] [-F] <CLUSTER> Collect attributes across a cluster. **Positional arguments:** ``<CLUSTER>`` Name or ID of cluster(s) to operate on. **Optional arguments:** ``-p <PATH>, --path <PATH>`` A Json path string specifying the attribute to collect. ``-L, --list`` Print a full list that contains both node ids and attribute values instead of values only. Default is True. ``-F, --full-id`` Print full IDs in list. can be specified multiple times, or once with key-value pairs separated by a semicolon... _senlin_cluster-run: senlin cluster-run ------------------ .. code-block:: console usage: senlin cluster-run [-p <PORT>] [-t ADDRESS_TYPE] [-n <NETWORK>] [-6] [-u <USER>] [-i IDENTITY_FILE] [-O SSH_OPTIONS] -s <FILE> <CLUSTER> Run shell scripts on all nodes of a cluster. **Positional arguments:** ``<CLUSTER>`` Name or ID of the cluster. **Optional arguments:** ``-p <PORT>, --port <PORT>`` Optional flag to indicate the port to use (Default=22). ``-t ADDRESS_TYPE, --address-type ADDRESS_TYPE`` Optional flag to indicate which IP type to use. Possible values includes 'fixed' and 'floating' (the Default). ``-n <NETWORK>, --network <NETWORK>`` Network to use for the ssh. ``-6, --ipv6`` Optional flag to indicate whether to use an IPv6 address attached to a server. (Defaults to IPv4 address) ``-u <USER>, --user <USER>`` Login to use. ``-i IDENTITY_FILE, --identity-file IDENTITY_FILE`` Private key file, same as the '-i' option to the ssh command. ``-O SSH_OPTIONS, --ssh-options SSH_OPTIONS`` Extra options to pass to ssh. see: man ssh. ``-s <FILE>, --script <FILE>`` Script file to run. can be specified multiple times, or once with key-value pairs separated by a semicolon. can be specified multiple times, or once with key-value pairs separated by a semicolon... _senlin_policy-validate: senlin policy-validate ---------------------- .. code-block:: console usage: senlin policy-validate -s <SPEC_FILE> VAlidate a policy spec. **Optional arguments:** ``-s <SPEC_FILE>, --spec-file <SPEC_FILE>`` The spec file used to create the policy. can be specified multiple times, or once with key-value pairs separated by a semicolon. can be specified multiple times, or once with key-value pairs separated by a semicolon. .. _senlin_profile-validate: senlin profile-validate ----------------------- .. code-block:: console usage: senlin profile-validate -s <SPEC FILE> Validate a profile. **Optional arguments:** ``-s <SPEC FILE>, --spec-file <SPEC FILE>`` The spec file used to create the profile. usage: senlin receiver-create [-t <TYPE>] [-c <CLUSTER>] [-a <ACTION>] Targeted cluster for this receiver. Required if receiver type is webhook. Required if receiver type is webhook.
deleted_lines: This chapter documents :command:`senlin` version ``0.5.0``. [--os-api-name <service>=<name>] [--os-api-region <service>=<region>] [--os-api-version <service>=<version>] [--os-api-interface <service>=<interface>] [--profile HMAC_KEY]``--os-api-name <service>=<name>`` Desired API names, defaults to ``env[OS_API_NAME]`` ``--os-api-region <service>=<region>`` Desired API region, defaults to ``env[OS_API_REGION]`` ``--os-api-version <service>=<version>`` Desired API versions, defaults to ``env[OS_API_VERSION]`` ``--os-api-interface <service>=<interface>`` Desired API interface, defaults to ``env[OS_INTERFACE]`` can be specified multiple times, or once with key- value pairs separated by a semicolon. can be specified multiple times, or once with key- value pairs separated by a semicolon. can be specified multiple times, or once with key- value pairs separated by a semicolon. can be specified multiple times, or once with key- value pairs separated by a semicolon. can be specified multiple times, or once with key- value pairs separated by a semicolon. usage: senlin receiver-create [-t <TYPE>] -c <CLUSTER> -a <ACTION> Targeted cluster for this receiver.

commit_message:
[cli-ref] Update python-manilaclient to 1.11.0

Change-Id: Iaf040a4a08c3c2d7fc8e39ed3579a2981bd422c7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/95/364695/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: This chapter documents :command:`manila` version ``1.11.0``.``snapshot-instance-list`` List share snapshot instances. ``snapshot-instance-reset-state`` Explicitly update the state of a share snapshot instance. ``snapshot-instance-show`` Show details about a share snapshot instance. Defaults to ``env[OS_MANILA_BYPASS_URL]``. Defaults to ``env[OS_MANILA_SERVICE_NAME]``. Defaults to ``env[OS_MANILA_SHARE_SERVICE_NAME]``. Defaults to ``env[OS_MANILA_ENDPOINT_TYPE]`` or publicURL. usage: manila migration-start [--force_host_assisted_migration <True|False>] [--preserve-metadata <True|False>] [--writable <True|False>] [--non-disruptive <True|False>] [--new_share_network <new_share_network>] [--new_share_type <new_share_type>] <share> <host@backend#pool>``<host@backend#pool>`` Destination host, backend and pool in format 'host@backend#pool'.``--force_host_assisted_migration <True|False>, --force-host-assisted-migration <True|False>`` Default=False. Renamed from "force_host_copy" in version 2.22. ``--preserve-metadata <True|False>, --preserve_metadata <True|False>`` Chooses whether migration should be forced to preserve all file metadata when moving its contents. Default=True. Introduced in version 2.22. ``--writable <True|False>`` Chooses whether migration should be forced to remain writable while contents are being moved. Default=True. Introduced in version 2.22. ``--non-disruptive <True|False>, --non_disruptive <True|False>`` Chooses whether migration should only be performed if it is not disruptive. Default=False. Introduced in version 2.22. ``--new_share_network <new_share_network>, --new-share-network <new_share_network>`` Specifies a new share network if desired to change. Default=None. Introduced in version 2.22. ``--new_share_type <new_share_type>, --new-share-type <new_share_type>`` Specifies a new share type if desired to change. Default=None. Introduced in version 2.22. data_copying_error. If no value is provided, None will be used. usage: manila share-replica-list [--share-id <share_id>] [--columns <columns>]``--columns <columns>`` Comma separated list of columns to be displayed e.g. :option:`--columns` "replica_state,id" .. _manila_snapshot-instance-list: manila snapshot-instance-list ----------------------------- .. code-block:: console usage: manila snapshot-instance-list [--snapshot <snapshot>] [--columns <columns>] [--detailed <detailed>] List share snapshot instances. **Optional arguments:** ``--snapshot <snapshot>`` Filter results by share snapshot ID. ``--columns <columns>`` Comma separated list of columns to be displayed e.g. :option:`--columns` "id" ``--detailed <detailed>`` Show detailed information about snapshot instances. (Default=False) .. _manila_snapshot-instance-reset-state: manila snapshot-instance-reset-state ------------------------------------ .. code-block:: console usage: manila snapshot-instance-reset-state [--state <state>] <snapshot_instance> Explicitly update the state of a share snapshot instance. **Positional arguments:** ``<snapshot_instance>`` ID of the snapshot instance to modify. **Optional arguments:** ``--state <state>`` Indicate which state to assign the snapshot instance. Options include available, error, creating, deleting, error_deleting. If no state is provided, available will be used. .. _manila_snapshot-instance-show: manila snapshot-instance-show ----------------------------- .. code-block:: console usage: manila snapshot-instance-show <snapshot_instance> Show details about a share snapshot instance. **Positional arguments:** ``<snapshot_instance>`` ID of the share snapshot instance.
deleted_lines: This chapter documents :command:`manila` version ``1.10.0``.``migrate`` (Deprecated) Migrates share to a new host (Admin only, Experimental). Defaults to ``env[MANILACLIENT_BYPASS_URL]``. Defaults to ``env[MANILA_SERVICE_NAME]``. Defaults to ``env[MANILA_share_service_name]``. Defaults to ``env[MANILA_ENDPOINT_TYPE]`` or publicURL. usage: manila migration-start [--force-host-copy <True|False>] [--notify <True|False>] <share> <host#pool>``<host#pool>`` Destination host and pool.``--force-host-copy <True|False>, --force_host_copy <True|False>`` Default=False. ``--notify <True|False>`` Enables or disables notification of data copying completed. Default=True. data_copying_error. If no value is provided, migration_error will be used. usage: manila share-replica-list [--share-id <share_id>]

Change-Id: I2b05446291c5fb5c923572dba65cb45617568afa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/82/364682/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: This chapter documents :command:`neutron` version ``6.0.0``.``auto-allocated-topology-delete`` Delete the auto-allocated topology of a given tenant. ``qos-minimum-bandwidth-rule-create`` Create a qos minimum bandwidth rule. ``qos-minimum-bandwidth-rule-delete`` Delete a given qos minimum bandwidth rule. ``qos-minimum-bandwidth-rule-list`` List all qos minimum bandwidth rules belonging to the specified policy. ``qos-minimum-bandwidth-rule-show`` Show information about the given qos minimum bandwidth rule. ``qos-minimum-bandwidth-rule-update`` Update the given qos minimum bandwidth rule. ``quota-default-show`` Show default quotas for a given tenant. Show quotas for a given tenant. ADDRESS_SCOPE [ADDRESS_SCOPE ...] ID(s) or name(s) of address_scope to delete. [--name NAME] [--shared {True,False}] Updated name of the address scope. ``--shared {True,False}`` Set sharing of address scope. (True means shared) usage: neutron agent-delete [-h] [--request-format {json}] AGENT [AGENT ...] ID(s) of agent to delete... _neutron_auto-allocated-topology-delete: neutron auto-allocated-topology-delete -------------------------------------- .. code-block:: console usage: neutron auto-allocated-topology-delete [-h] [--request-format {json}] [--tenant-id tenant-id] Delete the auto-allocated topology of a given tenant. **Optional arguments:** ``-h, --help`` show this help message and exit ``--request-format {json}`` **DEPRECATED!** Only JSON request format is supported. ``--tenant-id`` tenant-id The owner tenant ID. usage: neutron bgp-peer-delete [-h] [--request-format {json}] BGP_PEER [BGP_PEER ...] ID(s) or name(s) of bgp_peer to delete. usage: neutron bgp-speaker-delete [-h] [--request-format {json}] BGP_SPEAKER [BGP_SPEAKER ...] ID(s) or name(s) of bgp_speaker to delete. ID or name of the firewall policy associated to this firewall. ID or name of the router associated with the firewall (requires FWaaS router insertion extension to be enabled). This option can be repeated. router insertion extension). usage: neutron firewall-delete [-h] [--request-format {json}] FIREWALL [FIREWALL ...] ID(s) or name(s) of firewall to delete. FIREWALL_POLICY [FIREWALL_POLICY ...] ID(s) or name(s) of firewall_policy to delete. ID or name of the firewall rule to be removed from the policy. shared). auditing is enabled). FIREWALL_RULE [FIREWALL_RULE ...] ID(s) or name(s) of firewall_rule to delete. ID or name of the router associated with the firewall (requires FWaaS router insertion extension to be enabled). This option can be repeated. router insertion extension). ID or name of the firewall policy associated to this firewall. Update the admin state for the firewall (True means UP). ID or name of the flavor to associate. usage: neutron flavor-delete [-h] [--request-format {json}] FLAVOR [FLAVOR ...] ID(s) or name(s) of flavor to delete. ID or name of the flavor to be disassociated. SERVICE_PROFILE [SERVICE_PROFILE ...] ID(s) or name(s) of service_profile to delete. ID or name of the network from which the floating IP is allocated. usage: neutron floatingip-delete [-h] [--request-format {json}] FLOATINGIP [FLOATINGIP ...] ID(s) of floatingip to delete. [--admin-state-down] [--name NAME] [--description DESCRIPTION] [--peer-cidr PEER_CIDRS] --peer-id PEER_ID --peer-address PEER_ADDRESS --psk PSK [--mtu MTU] [--initiator {bi-directional,response-only}]``--name NAME`` Set friendly name for the connection. ``--description DESCRIPTION`` Set a description for the connection. Peer endpoint group ID/name with CIDR(s) for IPSec``--peer-cidr PEER_CIDRS`` [**DEPRECATED** in Mitaka] Remote subnet(s) in CIDR format. Cannot be specified when using endpoint groups. Only applicable, if subnet provided for VPN service. ``--peer-id PEER_ID`` Peer router identity for authentication. Can be IPv4/IPv6 address, e-mail address, key id, or FQDN. ``--peer-address PEER_ADDRESS`` Peer gateway public IPv4/IPv6 address or FQDN. ``--psk PSK`` Pre-shared key string. ``--mtu MTU`` MTU size for the connection, default:1500. ``--initiator {bi-directional,response-only}`` Initiator state in lowercase, default:bi-directional [IPSEC_SITE_CONNECTION ...] ID(s) or name(s) of IPsec site connection to delete. [--admin-state-up {True,False}] [--name NAME] [--description DESCRIPTION] [--peer-cidr PEER_CIDRS] [--peer-id PEER_ID] [--peer-address PEER_ADDRESS] [--psk PSK] [--mtu MTU] [--initiator {bi-directional,response-only}]``--admin-state-up {True,False}`` Update the administrative state. (True meaning "Up") ``--name NAME`` Set friendly name for the connection. ``--description DESCRIPTION`` Set a description for the connection. Peer endpoint group ID/name with CIDR(s) for IPSec``--peer-cidr PEER_CIDRS`` [**DEPRECATED** in Mitaka] Remote subnet(s) in CIDR format. Cannot be specified when using endpoint groups. Only applicable, if subnet provided for VPN service. ``--peer-id PEER_ID`` Peer router identity for authentication. commit_message:
Register keystone opts for placement sample config

This adds the keystone options that you would need into the sample
config generation for the placement section. It also cleans up neutron
config reference to be more like the ironic, which is a ton easier to
understand.

Change-Id: Id31b47b4fe20cd10bef20f1efe30b04d744a0f99

subject: Create/update vNICs properly on Plug
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-02 17:37:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova-powervm/commit/5ece2ca4a1b9357ba212a1afb2c51eec8b0aa820', 'message': 'WIP: Create/update vNICs properly on Plug

When deciding whether to "re-treat" or create a VIF, the PlugVifs Task
was only looking for CNAs with the matching MAC address.  With SR-IOV
VNIC, the VIF's MAC lives on the VNIC, not the CNA.

This change set detects whether a VIF is a VNIC; and if so, looks for a
matching VNIC rather than a matching CNA.

This change set also fixes a regression whereby PlugMgmtVif was only
looking in the list of pre-existing CNAs to see whether the management
VIF is already plugged.  We now do an explicit search in the execution
of PlugMgmtVif.

WIP: UT

Change-Id: I892f61d8cd3b07792d0cb16f4aaa643df3ec979c
Closes-Bug: #1619743
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-02 20:39:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova-powervm/commit/7ad90c97a8a45881955143b3aba6e7f89b72ad16', 'message': 'Create/update vNICs properly on Plug

matching VNIC rather than a matching CNA.

This change set also fixes a regression whereby PlugMgmtVif was only

When deciding whether to "re-treat" or create a VIF, the PlugVifs Task
was only looking for CNAs with the matching MAC address.  With SR-IOV
VNIC, the VIF's MAC lives on the VNIC, not the CNA.

This change set detects whether a VIF is a VNIC; and if so, looks for a
matching VNIC rather than a matching CNA.

This change set also fixes a regression whereby PlugMgmtVif was only
looking in the list of pre-existing CNAs to see whether the management
VIF is already plugged.  We now also keep track of which CNAs we create
during PlugVifs and pass them along.  For efficiency, if we never look
up the existing CNAs, we pass None through, and PlugMgmtVifs looks up

commit_message:
Create/update vNICs properly on Plug

When deciding whether to "re-treat" or create a VIF, the PlugVifs Task
was only looking for CNAs with the matching MAC address.  With SR-IOV
VNIC, the VIF's MAC lives on the VNIC, not the CNA.

This change set detects whether a VIF is a VNIC; and if so, looks for a
matching VNIC rather than a matching CNA.

This change set also fixes a regression whereby PlugMgmtVif was only
looking in the list of pre-existing CNAs to see whether the management
VIF is already plugged.  We now also keep track of which CNAs we create
during PlugVifs and pass them along.  For efficiency, if we never look
up the existing CNAs, we pass None through, and PlugMgmtVifs looks up
the CNAs afresh.

Change-Id: I892f61d8cd3b07792d0cb16f4aaa643df3ec979c
Closes-Bug: #1619743
