commit_message:
Make L3 agent use different request-id for each request

Generate a new context object request-id for each reference
to self.context. This allows easier tracking of requests
in logs.

This is the L3 agent equivalent fix of
I1d6dc28ba4752d3f9f1020851af2960859aae520.

Related-Bug: #1618231
Closes-Bug: #1619524
Change-Id: I4a49f05ce0e7467084a1c27a64a0d4cf60a5f8cb

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-02 04:29:56.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/migration/libvirt.pp', 'spec/classes/nova_migration_libvirt_spec.rb'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova/commit/a8e3d482bef3523145fe3808e8a9ba865ec043df', 'message': 'add libvirt live_migration timeout parameters

This commit adds support for the libvirt live_migration_progress_timeout
and live_migration_completion_timeout parameters. These parameters are
useful for configuring timeouts for live_migration in cases where the
network is slower (e.g. 1GbE) or where the RAM usage is large. In both
these cases, timeouts can occur while live migrating using the default

Change-Id: Id728b3aa184d4218fcecea4e716e3b644668af85
'}]
commit_message:
add libvirt live_migration timeout parameters

This commit adds support for the libvirt live_migration_progress_timeout
and live_migration_completion_timeout parameters. These parameters are
useful for configuring timeouts for live_migration in cases where the
network is slower (e.g. 1GbE) or where the RAM usage is large. In both
these cases, timeouts can occur while live migrating using the default
libvirt values in nova.

Change-Id: Id728b3aa184d4218fcecea4e716e3b644668af85

commit_message:
Add OS::Cinder::Quota resource

This creates new resource type whose intended use case is for admin-only
use and to manage the cinder quotas (gigabytes, volumes, snapshots).

implements bp cinder-quota-resource

Co-Authored-By: Andy Hsiang <yh418t@att.com>
Co-Authored-By: Yosef Hoffman <yh128t@att.com>

Change-Id: I49d01d229199d9c472dc59ba2bb95d455f6dfb76

added_lines: # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import mock import six from heat.common import exception from heat.common import template_format from heat.engine.clients.os import cinder as c_plugin from heat.engine import stack as parser from heat.engine import template from heat.tests import common from heat.tests import utils quota_template = ''' heat_template_version: newton description: Sample cinder quota heat template resources: my_quota: type: OS::Cinder::Quota properties: project: demo gigabytes: 1 snapshots: 2 volumes: 3 ''' class CinderQuotaTest(common.HeatTestCase): def setUp(self): super(CinderQuotaTest, self).setUp() self.ctx = utils.dummy_context() self.patchobject(c_plugin.CinderClientPlugin, 'has_extension', return_value=True) tpl = template_format.parse(quota_template) self.stack = parser.Stack( self.ctx, 'cinder_quota_test_stack', template.Template(tpl) ) self.my_quota = self.stack['my_quota'] cinder = mock.MagicMock() self.cinderclient = mock.MagicMock() self.my_quota.client = cinder cinder.return_value = self.cinderclient self.project_id = '41f0e60c-ebb4-4375-a2b4-845ae8b9c995' keystone = mock.MagicMock() keystone.get_project_id = mock.MagicMock(return_value=self.project_id) self.my_quota.client_plugin = mock.MagicMock(return_value=keystone) self.quotas = self.cinderclient.quotas self.quota_set = mock.MagicMock() self.quotas.update.return_value = self.quota_set self.quotas.delete.return_value = self.quota_set def _test_validate(self, resource, error_msg): exc = self.assertRaises(exception.StackValidationFailed, resource.validate) self.assertIn(error_msg, six.text_type(exc)) def _test_invalid_property(self, prop_name): my_quota = self.stack['my_quota'] props = self.stack.t.t['resources']['my_quota']['properties'].copy() props[prop_name] = -2 my_quota.t = my_quota.t.freeze(properties=props) my_quota.reparse() error_msg = ('Property error: resources.my_quota.properties.%s:' ' -2 is out of range (min: -1, max: None)' % prop_name) self._test_validate(my_quota, error_msg) def test_invalid_gigabytes(self): self._test_invalid_property('gigabytes') def test_invalid_snapshots(self): self._test_invalid_property('snapshots') def test_invalid_volumes(self): self._test_invalid_property('volumes') def test_miss_project(self): my_quota = self.stack['my_quota'] props = self.stack.t.t['resources']['my_quota']['properties'].copy() del props['project'] my_quota.t = my_quota.t.freeze(properties=props) my_quota.reparse() error_msg = 'Property project not assigned' self._test_validate(my_quota, error_msg) def test_miss_all_quotas(self): my_quota = self.stack['my_quota'] props = self.stack.t.t['resources']['my_quota']['properties'].copy() del props['gigabytes'] del props['snapshots'] del props['volumes'] my_quota.t = my_quota.t.freeze(properties=props) my_quota.reparse() error_msg = ('No quota provided. At least one quota (gigabytes, ' 'snapshots or volumes) should be provided.') self._test_validate(my_quota, error_msg) def test_quota_handle_create(self): quota_set = self.my_quota.handle_create() self.quotas.update.assert_called_once_with( self.project_id, gigabytes=1, snapshots=2, volumes=3 ) self.assertEqual(quota_set, self.quota_set) def test_quota_handle_update(self): json_snippet = mock.MagicMock() tmpl_diff = mock.MagicMock() prop_diff = {'gigabytes': 2, 'volumes': 4} quota_set = self.my_quota.handle_update( json_snippet, tmpl_diff, prop_diff) self.quotas.update.assert_called_once_with( self.project_id, gigabytes=2, volumes=4 ) self.assertEqual(quota_set, self.quota_set) def test_quota_handle_delete(self): quota_set = self.my_quota.handle_delete() self.quotas.delete.assert_called_once_with(self.project_id) self.assertEqual(quota_set, self.quota_set)

commit_message:
Add support to re-assign a set of nodes

This patch adds an ability to re-assign a set of the given nodes at
once. This feature was technically available but not exposed to the
client. A groupped re-assigning allows to effectively re-provision nodes
by creating an atomic task in Astute.

Change-Id: I4a7c7e35d844683ef73ad7f8459d1892e80e0a64
Related-Bug: #1616925

commit_message:
Use fallocate for swapfile if on ext

fallocate is much quicker than writing an 8GB file of zeros but it only
works reliably for swapfiles on ext filesystems. Check what the
filesystem type is and use fallocate if on an ext fs.

Change-Id: I8861005a842bd82151c250edef99c2017f09a81a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate refs/changes/47/312647/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if df -T ${swapfile} | grep -q ext ; then sudo fallocate -l ${swapdiff}M ${swapfile} else # Cannot fallocate on filesystems like XFS sudo dd if=/dev/zero of=${swapfile} bs=1M count=${swapdiff} fi
deleted_lines: sudo dd if=/dev/zero of=${swapfile} bs=1M count=${swapdiff}

subject: Fix bug with identity client memoization
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-02 21:31:12.000000000', 'files': ['syntribos/extensions/identity/client.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/syntribos/commit/1c0d5478213fc57fa9e06dcb30b7bfe6b66cd022', 'message': 'Fix bug with identity client memoization

Our memoization function only looks at "args" and not "kwargs", so any
call that includes only kwargs will appear as empty arguments, meaning
subsequent calls with different kwargs will be ignored.

This patch removes the @memoize decorator from all but the token calls
in the identity client.

Change-Id: I922a3b950a3c56448453675bbc19e69b86fed079
'}]
commit_message:
Fix bug with identity client memoization

Our memoization function only looks at "args" and not "kwargs", so any
call that includes only kwargs will appear as empty arguments, meaning
subsequent calls with different kwargs will be ignored.

This patch removes the @memoize decorator from all but the token calls
in the identity client.

Change-Id: I922a3b950a3c56448453675bbc19e69b86fed079

commit_message:
Support lazy tables in openstack drivers

OpenStack datasource drivers support lazy_tables flag.

Implements blueprint: selectable-translator

Change-Id: I0f4dfb386243d99423e63e2fcad2eb64b8ae5498
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/congress refs/changes/26/364326/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from congress.datasources import constants self.initialize_update_methods() result['config']['lazy_tables'] = constants.OPTIONAL def initialize_update_methods(self): networks_method = lambda: self._translate_networks( self.neutron.list_networks()) self.add_update_method(networks_method, self.networks_translator) ports_method = lambda: self._translate_ports(self.neutron.list_ports()) self.add_update_method(ports_method, self.ports_translator) routers_method = lambda: self._translate_routers( self.neutron.list_routers()) self.add_update_method(routers_method, self.routers_translator) security_method = lambda: self._translate_security_group( self.neutron.list_security_groups()) self.add_update_method(security_method, self.security_groups_translator) @datasource_utils.update_state_on_changed(NETWORKS) return row_data @datasource_utils.update_state_on_changed(PORTS) return row_data @datasource_utils.update_state_on_changed(ROUTERS) return row_data @datasource_utils.update_state_on_changed(SECURITY_GROUPS) return row_data
deleted_lines: # Store raw state (result of API calls) so that we can # avoid re-translating and re-sending if no changes occurred. # Because translation is not deterministic (we're generating # UUIDs), it's hard to tell if no changes occurred # after performing the translation. self.raw_state = {} def update_from_datasource(self): """Called when it is time to pull new data from this datasource. Sets self.state[tablename] = <set of tuples of strings/numbers> for every tablename exported by this datasource. """ LOG.debug("Neutron grabbing networks") networks = self.neutron.list_networks() if ('networks' not in self.raw_state or networks != self.raw_state['networks']): self.raw_state['networks'] = networks self._translate_networks(networks) LOG.debug("Neutron grabbing ports") ports = self.neutron.list_ports() if 'ports' not in self.raw_state or ports != self.raw_state['ports']: self.raw_state['ports'] = ports self._translate_ports(ports) LOG.debug("Neutron grabbing routers") routers = self.neutron.list_routers() if ('routers' not in self.raw_state or routers != self.raw_state['routers']): self.raw_state['routers'] = routers self._translate_routers(routers) LOG.debug("Neutron grabbing security groups") security = self.neutron.list_security_groups() if ('security_groups' not in self.raw_state or security != self.raw_state['security_groups']): self.raw_state['security_groups'] = security self._translate_security_groups(security) network_tables = (self.NETWORKS, self.NETWORKS_SUBNETS) for table in network_tables: self.state[table] = set() for table, row in row_data: assert table in network_tables self.state[table].add(row) LOG.debug("NETWORKS: %s", self.state[self.NETWORKS]) LOG.debug("NETWORKS_SUBNETS: %s", self.state[self.NETWORKS_SUBNETS]) port_tables = (self.PORTS, self.PORTS_ADDR_PAIRS, self.PORTS_SECURITY_GROUPS, self.PORTS_BINDING_CAPABILITIES, self.PORTS_FIXED_IPS, self.PORTS_FIXED_IPS_GROUPS, self.PORTS_EXTRA_DHCP_OPTS) for table in port_tables: self.state[table] = set() for table, row in row_data: assert table in port_tables self.state[table].add(row) for table in port_tables: LOG.debug('%s: %s', table, self.state[table]) router_tables = (self.ROUTERS, self.ROUTERS_EXTERNAL_GATEWAYS) for table in router_tables: self.state[table] = set() for table, row in row_data: assert table in router_tables self.state[table].add(row) for table in router_tables: LOG.debug('%s: %s', table, self.state[table]) security_group_tables = (self.SECURITY_GROUPS,) for table in security_group_tables: self.state[table] = set() for table, row in row_data: assert table in security_group_tables self.state[table].add(row) for table in security_group_tables: LOG.debug('%s: %s', table, self.state[table])

commit_message:
Add deb-python-{keystoneauth1,requestsexceptions}

Both are runtime depends on os-client-config.

Needed-By: I41319c53724b58d9217398c31f75217ed1300792
Change-Id: I6b6d2f7ee076cc38a950c8fffdc441f573a28bbb

be built.  And Instances need to be written to the instance table in
cell0 on failure, as well as relations like bdms/security_groups/etc...

commit_message:
WIP Map instances to cell0 on failed schedule

Add an instance mapping for failed instances. This adds an instance
mapping for instances which have failed before being assigned a cell.
The instances will be mapped to cell0.

Co-authored-by: Mark Doffman <mjdoffma@us.ibm.com>
Co-authored-by: Andrey Volkov <avolkov@mirantis.com>
blueprint cells-cell0

Change-Id: I3fb28f5a22c0aeb1403b9abc39da2b42581b3443
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/27/267827/30 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cell = objects.CellMapping.get_cell0(context) inst_mapping = objects.InstanceMapping(context, instance.uuid) inst_mapping.cell_id = cell.id inst_mapping.save()

commit_message:
Drop overcloud-without-mergepy.yaml (again!)

This file was mistakenly re-added in
25ad7b8e1eeeb0e1f5f83b9f7560502717b44536.

It is breaking subsequent refactoring and preventing us
from landing the last few composable services patches.

Change-Id: I41b951d769f4545ee8e30afdf40fe8c7638b4b12
Closes-bug: #1619786

commit_message:
Add `extra` parameter to ExistingCloud deployment

Sometimes user needs to specify some extra options related to deployment.
Previously it was possible, but after we merged strict json validation,
users are not able to do it.

Let's provide the way to do it.

Also, this patch extends json schema with domain_name variable, since it is
used in several places.

Change-Id: I675086c97f2f34cf67b86576031f90bb13818ac3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/43/364443/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: To specify extra custom options use can use special "custom_options" parameter: .. code-block:: json { "type": "ExistingCloud", "auth_url": "http://localhost:5000/v2.0/", "region_name": "RegionOne", "endpoint_type": "public", "admin": { "username": "admin", "password": "password", "tenant_name": "demo" }, "https_insecure": False, "https_cacert": "", "custom_options": {"some_var": "some_value"} } "domain_name": {"type": "string"}, }, "custom_options": {"type": "object", "additionalProperties": True}

commit_message:
Ensure that PK values don't default to NULL

MySQL 5.7 is stricter by default; ensure that the primary key
of cisco_csr_identifier_map does not end up with NULL default
otherwise the migration step will fail with:

 'All parts of a PRIMARY KEY must be NOT NULL; if you need NULL in a key, use UNIQUE instead'

Behavioural change introduced in 5.7.3:

 http://dev.mysql.com/doc/relnotes/mysql/5.7/en/news-5-7-3.html

Change-Id: Iad2033bec39d223556c2605e3ba3f3dab44223a1
Closes-Bug: #1567899
(cherry picked from commit 3aeae7a3e5a351577002237663ed08ac908d5b45)

commit_message:
Remove Foreign Key constraint during ALTER

Beginning with MySQL 5.6, ALTER will fail if there are foreign key
constraints affecting the column being altered.  This patch
removes the constraint, before applying the update and then
restores the constraint.

Change-Id: I0982ec34d51f9e8004d85512bc8e0cde7b84b4f2
Depends-On: Id3f199d688d648f4618a6850d094e26ca6bb9a7f
Closes-Bug: 1544349
(cherry picked from commit f4babb050ba5a54c9c9f91e2d1ac370539dadf3c)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-vpnaas refs/changes/53/296553/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron.db import migration # Need to drop foreign key constraint before mysql will allow changes with migration.remove_fks_from_table('cisco_csr_identifier_map'): op.alter_column(table_name='cisco_csr_identifier_map', column_name='ipsec_site_conn_id', type_=sa.String(36), existing_nullable=True)

commit_message:
Use assertIn(A, B) instead of assertTrue(A in B )

Developers should use assertIn(A, B) instead of assertTrue(A in B ).

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Iac3cf6a6be2f8a83507216dea85c4d33f02eaa14

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # # == Class: tripleo::profile::base::neutron::helpers::plumgrid # # Plumgrid Neutron helper profile (extra settings for compute, etc. roles) # # === Parameters # [*step*] # (Optional) The current step of the deployment # Defaults to hiera('step') # class tripleo::profile::base::neutron::helpers::plumgrid ( $step = hiera('step'), ) { if $step >= 4 { # forward all ipv4 traffic # this is required for the vms to pass through the gateways public interface sysctl::value { 'net.ipv4.ip_forward': value => '1' } # ifc_ctl_pp needs to be invoked by root as part of the vif.py when a VM is powered on file { '/etc/sudoers.d/ifc_ctl_sudoers': ensure => file, owner => root, group => root, mode => '0440', content => "nova ALL=(root) NOPASSWD: /opt/pg/bin/ifc_ctl_pp *\n", } } }

Closes-bug: 1619696

commit_message:
db migration: Alter column before setting a FK on column

MySQL doesn't like foreign key columns to be modified,
this adjusts the script to add all constraints and make
modifications before setting up the foreign key relationship.

Change-Id: I494758120c8a87fe584c781b928f8b9d3bac5291
Closes-bug: 1619696

Third of three changesets for Community level image sharing.

Current status:
* API will accept 'shared' as a visiblity value
* Old-style shared images (private visibility with a member) are now
        migrated to the new-style (shared visibility), with unit test

commit_message:
WIP Utilize the new 'shared' visibility value

Third of three changesets for Community level image sharing.

Current status:
* API will accept 'shared' as a visiblity value
* Old-style shared images (private visibility with a member) are now
        migrated to the new-style (shared visibility), with unit test
* Image membership operations now restricted to images with 'shared'
        visibility

Partially Implements bp community-level-v2-image-sharing

Change-Id: Ic99c6356ebd3ff156f7c7967798c049cb253fa90

commit_message:
Adding capability to retrieve scoped tokens

Services other than OpenStack requires scoped tokens.
Added methods to retrieve scoped tokens from keystone.

Change-Id: I171beabf62de3e27f13906bcd6e193ccc71e6c9d

commit_message:
Windows SMB: remove redundant operations

When setting access rules, we first set the rules per share,
execute the cmdlet which will update the filesystem ACLs based on
the share ACLs, and then use icacls to set filesystem ACLs again.

This is redundant and the last step can be dropped.

Change-Id: I3a5db71c697605e74243df0cf1d184d0b0fd4e8e

added_lines: The Murano Plugin for Fuel ========================== The Murano plugin for Fuel is a plugin to install the Application Catalog Service for OpenStack. The Murano plugin provides flexibility for the OpenStack Application Catalog service by supporting multiple releases and versions. Also, the plugin provides the capability to detach Murano from the controller node as a separate node.

Use revision to discard stale DHCP updates

This utilizes the new revision number to discard stale
port updates on the DHCP agent.

Change-Id: I8c904b63515692039e7e2bf6cf8c48f3575c5bc1
Partially-Implements: bp/push-notifications

This patch renames path com.ibm to org.openstack, as is needed
to join OpenStack big tent in the future

commit_message:
Change tox.ini to use nosetests directly

To track upstream OpenStack style, we can run nosetests directly
via tox.ini config. This patch also add some extra option to show
useful statement report for development.

Change-Id: Ic94dc1074f731c952914266ad17e11161d7ec435
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/storlets refs/changes/54/364254/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: NOSE_WITH_COVERAGE=1 NOSE_COVER_BRANCHES=1commands = find . -type f -name "*.py[c|o]" -delete find . -type d -name "__pycache__" -delete nosetests {posargs:tests/unit} -v find rm

commit_message:
Close metadata read md

As a result in some refactoring of storlet gateway modules, currently
storlet gateway leaks metadata read md for each storlet execution.

This patch fixes that leaking.

Change-Id: I7ed681bd0c5462d76e6c9ca361c2c2fb8293321f

positives with the command injection test, due to an overlap between
the payload and the failure keys of the command injection test.

Change-Id: I8ea1782d008438876fbd77dbacfdffb2f3b70ae2
'}]
commit_message:
Removing overlapping payload/failure key

One of the payloads in the LDAP fuzz strings can trigger false
positives with the command injection test, due to an overlap between
the payload and the failure keys of the command injection test.

Tried introducing a unittest to prevent this, but utilizing payloads
files in unittests is too tricky at this point.

Change-Id: I8ea1782d008438876fbd77dbacfdffb2f3b70ae2

commit_message:
Use absolute path for /etc/monasca

By default the config files end up in /usr/loca/etc/monasca instead of
/etc/monasca.

Change-Id: Ib98677409879939fb839f0432da63649c0b5e67d
Closes-Bug: #1613163

commit_message:
Don't build releasenotes in normal docs build

The release notes system exists in parallel and publishes to
http://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/os-client-config/. When we build
them in the normal doc build, it causes problems for distro packagers.

Change-Id: I6b084a1ad6836beac991d03c5f134203512150ac

Rename os-failures to os-faults

"os-faults" better reflects the main purpose of the library -
to inject faults into running OpenStack clouds.

commit_message:
Merge tag '1.16.0' into debian/newton

1/ import upstream os-client-config 1.16.0 release
2/ update debian/changelog for this new release
3/ Disabled tests and unavailable build-depends-indep
4/ Add python-reno and git as build-depends-indep.
5/ Add Monty's patch to avoid building release notes at build time.

Change-Id: Iec8f54a30f9c2edbb0c0a469710945a167578286

commit_message:
Ignore EEXIST when removing measures directories

On Linux, rmdir() sets errno to ENOTEMPTY when the directory is not
empty.  On Solaris, it sets errno to EEXIST.  They should be treated
equivalently here.

Change-Id: I1024e757ac46936a421cc2a1013a0b5735747719
Closes-Bug: #1619509
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/gnocchi refs/changes/01/364601/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # EEXIST: some systems use this instead of ENOTEMPTY if e.errno not in (errno.ENOENT, errno.ENOTEMPTY, errno.EEXIST):
deleted_lines: if e.errno != errno.ENOENT and e.errno != errno.ENOTEMPTY:

one) before creating other resources. Currently, networking_odl during full sync,
pushes other resources before sync'ing security_groups/sg_rules.

ACL Service in ODL Controller would look at port[security_group] and would try to
apply the corresponding ACL flows on the VM ports. But since, SG/SG_rules are
sync'ed later, the first attempt in ACL service to program the flows returns a
WARNING saying that "ACL is empty". However, subsequently when SG/SG_rules are
sync'ed the necessary ACL flows are applied on the VM ports. This patch attempts
to optimize this by sync'ing the SG/SG_Rules prior to sync'ing the other resources

commit_message:
Sync Security Groups and SG Rules before other resources

Neutron validates that a default security group is available (if not, it creates
one) before creating other resources. Currently, networking_odl during full sync,
pushes other resources before sync'ing security_groups/sg_rules.

ACL Service in ODL Controller would look at port[security_group] and would try to
apply the corresponding ACL flows on the VM ports. But since, SG/SG_rules are
sync'ed later, the first attempt in ACL service to program the flows returns a
WARNING saying that "ACL is empty". However, subsequently when SG/SG_rules are
sync'ed the necessary ACL flows are applied on the VM ports. This patch attempts
to optimize this by sync'ing the SG/SG_Rules prior to sync'ing the other resources
- which is in-line with Neutron behavior.

Change-Id: Ibfdc183dccd3e13559ae80fcb523ac1e0d3eea1d

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-01 20:54:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/5849c582d63b3af66c3c66f634c0b6808166b252', 'message': "Fix AddrFormatError in DHCPv6 lease release code

lease file.

Change-Id: I0964fe9d00f8f3922041b12c352449e943b8f251
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-01 21:03:46.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_dhcp.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/dhcp.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/2d67b68cc41e16914a2007ab3883a5c9995d1cd3', 'message': "Fix AddrFormatError in DHCPv6 lease release code

A change that merged recently for DHCPv6 lease release
did not have the correct format for the lease file in
the unit test, so we started seeing these today from
the functional tests:

AddrFormatError: failed to detect a valid IP address from '[2003::2]'

We have to strip the brackets from IPs read from the
lease file.

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/301747/ was the culprit.

Closes-bug: 1619463

Change-Id: I0964fe9d00f8f3922041b12c352449e943b8f251
"}]
commit_message:
Fix AddrFormatError in DHCPv6 lease release code

A change that merged recently for DHCPv6 lease release
did not have the correct format for the lease file in
the unit test, so we started seeing these today from
the functional tests:

AddrFormatError: failed to detect a valid IP address from '[2003::2]'

We have to strip the brackets from IPs read from the
lease file.

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/301747/ was the culprit.

Closes-bug: 1619463

Change-Id: I0964fe9d00f8f3922041b12c352449e943b8f251

commit_message:
Add volume clone flag to clone tests

test_volumes_clone and test_volumes_clone_negative are cloning in
their tests, but don't have the volume clone tag in them for
disabling in Tempest. This patch adds the tag to both of these
tests.

Closes-Bug: 1615770

Change-Id: Iff0f1bd8996bb8aa982ee0f3373e7454221ae41e

commit_message:
Change quota_injected_file_path_bytes to quota_injected_file_path_length

'quota_injected_file_path_bytes' has been renamed to
'quota_injected_file_path_length' long time ago, this patch fixes this
issue in devstack.

commit_message:
Merge tag '1.16.0' into debian/newton

1/ import upstream os-client-config 1.16.0 release
2/ update debian/changelog for this new release
3/ Disabled tests and unavailable build-depends-indep
4/ Add python-reno and git as build-depends-indep.
5/ Add Monty's patch to avoid building release notes at build time.

Change-Id: Iec8f54a30f9c2edbb0c0a469710945a167578286

subject: Always return a sorted list of drivers for configs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-01 23:01:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance_store/commit/489324ca58295f8ad005e9f4d08b418147aad6d1', 'message': 'Always return a sorted list of drivers for configs

glance.store entry point used in Glance for the store library is
resulting in generating random order in each run of the ``tox -e
genconfig`` command. This is because of the unsorted iterator returned
by the stevedore extension manager [1, 2].

This commit fixes that and returs a deterministic, sorted list of
drivers to generate the configs in Glance.

Closes-Bug: 1619487

[1] https://github.com/openstack/glance_store/blob/22fa2b08e76a8ebc39ade92504aeafb0bf8d2f8c/glance_store/backend.py#L135
[2] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/stevedore/managers.html#stevedore.extension.ExtensionManager.__iter__

Change-Id: I3146b8597a5d89da49b84d6653edacc3067c2c71

commit_message:
Always return a sorted list of drivers for configs

glance.store entry point used in Glance for the store library is
resulting in generating random order in each run of the ``tox -e
genconfig`` command. This is because of the unsorted iterator returned
by the stevedore extension manager [1, 2].

This commit fixes that and returs a deterministic, sorted list of
drivers to generate the configs in Glance.

Example scenario is at change Iea2c538b37182191445cc5c1f8b2d9dceed06343

Closes-Bug: 1619487

[1] https://github.com/openstack/glance_store/blob/22fa2b08e76a8ebc39ade92504aeafb0bf8d2f8c/glance_store/backend.py#L135
[2] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/stevedore/managers.html#stevedore.extension.ExtensionManager.__iter__

Co-Authored-By: Joshua Harlow <jxharlow@godaddy.com>

Change-Id: I3146b8597a5d89da49b84d6653edacc3067c2c71
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance_store refs/changes/86/364586/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix tox setup

Use proper combination of tox settings so that we install our sources
and not install the latest release of openstackdocstheme from pip since
it's a dependency of os-api-ref.

This works around a regression in tox/virtualenv/setuptools.

Co-Authored-By: Jeremy Stanley <fungi@yuggoth.org>
Change-Id: I6b3bf39d517a757cfc7240c770f4da67cccc0a3e

commit_message:
Fix pip install

Remove -U, otherwise os-api-ref will install openstackdocstheme from
pypi instead of the local tree. Also, add skipsdist.

Co-Authored-By: Jeremy Stanley <fungi@yuggoth.org>
Change-Id: Idb89ec2da6df17ef86f6e6206e18db94835f3c82

commit_message:
LVM: Handle missing loop device at cleanup

When the loop device is not present because something
has gone wrong, this will print an error:
"losetup: option requires an argument -- 'd'"

Just skip the losetup -d in this case.

Change-Id: Iedc439b1ae924e9a599f6522eb081b83d43190c7

commit_message:
Calculate free space for custom backup dir

Fix verify_disk_space procedure to check custom
backup dir provided in command line.

Fix regression with restore database.
We have no proper way to restore database during
nonfull backup because nonfull backup was masked
by error in verify_disk_space function.
Full restore was also switched to proper restore
of database to increase stability of restoring.
Also fix compress and uncompress to more efficient way.

Change-Id: Idd0bead1d8362511be4d9550f7fab0f5c88a7724
Closes-Bug: #1544204
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/74/363774/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: verify_disk_space "backup" "$fullbackup" "$backup_dir" # Remember current dir just in case someone expecting that function # wouldn't change directory. For legacy. local cwd=`pwd` cd ${backup_dir} local component_tars=(*.tar *.sql) echo "Compressing ${component_tars[@]}" tar -c -O ${component_tars[@]} | lrzip ${lrzopts} -o fuel_backup${image_suffix}.tar.lrz rm -f "${component_tars[@]}" cd ${cwd}function restore_database { local fuel_ver=$(fuel --version 2>&1) local external_dir=/var/lib/fuel/container_data/${fuel_ver%\.[0-9]}/postgres/backups/ local internal_dir=/var/lib/pgsql/backups/ local log_file=${internal_dir}/restore.log cp ${restoredir}/postgres_backup.sql $external_dir/ || exit 1 if ! shell_container postgres su - postgres -c "psql -f ${internal_dir}/postgres_backup.sql postgres > ${log_file} 2>&1"; then echo "Failed to restore database" exit 1; fi; } mkdir -p "$restoredir" || exit 1 verify_disk_space "restore" "$fullrestore" $restoredir echo "Restore database" start_container postgres restore_database lrzip -d $backupfile -o - | tar -x -C "$restoredir" if [[ $# -ne 3 ]]; then echo "Function verify_disk_space requere 3 arguments: " echo "operation type, backup type, backup dir" echo "Checking space in $3 for $1" if [[ "$2" != 1 ]]; then spaceerror="Insufficient disk space to perform $1. At least 2gb must be free on ${3} partition." spaceerror="Insufficient disk space to perform $1. At least 11gb must be free on ${3} partition." avail=$(df --output=avail ${3} | tail -1)
deleted_lines: verify_disk_space "backup" "$fullbackup" component_tars=($backup_dir/*.tar) ( cd $backup_dir && tar cf $backup_dir/fuel_backup${image_suffix}.tar *.tar *.sql) rm -rf "${component_tars[@]}" lrzip $lrzopts "$backup_dir/fuel_backup${image_suffix}.tar" -o "$backup_dir/fuel_backup${image_suffix}.tar.lrz" verify_disk_space "restore" "$fullrestore" mkdir -p "$restoredir" lrzip -d -o "$restoredir/fuel_backup.tar" $backupfile tar -xf "$restoredir/fuel_backup.tar" -C "$restoredir" && rm -f "$restoredir/fuel_backup.tar" if [ -z "$1" ]; then echo "Backup or restore operation not specified." 1>&2 fullbackup=1 if [[ "$2" != "$fullbackup" ]]; then spaceerror="Insufficient disk space to perform $1. At least 2gb must be free on ${BACKUP_ROOT} partition." spaceerror="Insufficient disk space to perform $1. At least 11gb must be free on ${BACKUP_ROOT} partition." avail=$(df --output=avail ${BACKUP_ROOT} | tail -1)

You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """ Import related utilities and helper functions. """ import sys import traceback def import_class(import_str): """Returns a class from a string including module and class.""" mod_str, _sep, class_str = import_str.rpartition('.') __import__(mod_str) try: return getattr(sys.modules[mod_str], class_str) except AttributeError: raise ImportError('Class %s cannot be found (%s)' % (class_str, traceback.format_exception(*sys.exc_info()))) def import_object(import_str, *args, **kwargs): """Import a class and return an instance of it.""" return import_class(import_str)(*args, **kwargs) def import_object_ns(name_space, import_str, *args, **kwargs): """Tries to import object from default namespace. Imports a class and return an instance of it, first by trying to find the class in a default namespace, then failing back to a full path if not found in the default namespace. """ import_value = "%s.%s" % (name_space, import_str) try: return import_class(import_value)(*args, **kwargs) except ImportError: return import_class(import_str)(*args, **kwargs) def import_module(import_str): """Import a module.""" __import__(import_str) return sys.modules[import_str] def import_versioned_module(version, submodule=None): module = 'solumclient.v%s' % version if submodule: module = '.'.join((module, submodule)) return import_module(module) def try_import(import_str, default=None): """Try to import a module and if it fails return default.""" try: return import_module(import_str) except ImportError: return default

commit_message:
[DOCS] Clarify is_metal is required if using iSCSI

When using a storage backend which depends on the iSCSI protocol, such
as a NetApp or VNX appliance in iSCSI mode, cinder would work only
partially. New volumes could be created, but download to image and
backup routines would not work, and the reason would not be clear from
the logs.

Change-Id: I361e5e85153886a12ca777f83f7aa60c67b6fbe9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_cinder refs/changes/10/363310/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Single Point of Failure. Also by default, the cinder volume service is deployed outside a container. .. note:: When using LVM or any backends `depending on the iSCSI protocol <https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/lxc/+bug/1226855>`_, the volume service must be deployed directly to the host, therefore ``is_metal`` is ``true`` by default.
deleted_lines: Single Point of Failure. As a result of the volume service being deployed directly to the host, ``is_metal`` is ``true`` when using LVM.

added_lines: from neutron.objects import base as base_objfrom neutron.objects import address_scope as addressscope_obj as_obj = addressscope_obj.AddressScope.get_object(context, id=id) if as_obj is None: else: return as_obj address_scope = addressscope_obj.AddressScope(context, **pool_args) address_scope.create() address_scope.update_fields(a_s) address_scope.update() pager = base_obj.Pager(sorts, limit, page_reverse, marker) address_scopes = addressscope_obj.AddressScope.get_objects( context, _pager=pager, **filters) return [ self._make_address_scope_dict(addr_scope, fields) for addr_scope in address_scopes ] address_scope.delete()
deleted_lines: try: return self._get_by_id(context, as_model.AddressScope, id) except exc.NoResultFound: address_scope = as_model.AddressScope(**pool_args) context.session.add(address_scope) address_scope.update(a_s) marker_obj = self._get_marker_obj(context, 'addrscope', limit, marker) collection = self._get_collection(context, as_model.AddressScope, self._make_address_scope_dict, filters=filters, fields=fields, sorts=sorts, limit=limit, marker_obj=marker_obj, page_reverse=page_reverse) return collection context.session.delete(address_scope)

subject: rt: ensure resource provider records exist from RT
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-22 18:07:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/83da6075845f7ec34ab6dd3496031ec6f202625e', 'message': 'rt: ensure resource provider records exist from RT

This patch adds functionality to the scheduler "report client" to ensure
that the client calls the placement API to create a resource provider
record for the local compute host managed by the Nova resource tracker.

The report client keeps a cache of resource provider objects, keyed by
resource provider UUID and constructed from the results of placement
REST API calls to get information about a resource provider. If a
resource provider matching a UUID was not found in the placement REST
API, code exists to automatically create the resource provider record
via the placement REST API.

Included in this patch is a new [placement] nova.conf configuration
section with a single os_region_name configuration option that allows
Nova to grab the placement API endpoint URL for the particular OpenStack
region that it is in. We do not support endpoint URL overrides for the
placement API service. We only use the Keystone service catalog for
finding the endpoint for the placement service.

Change-Id: I9d28b51da25c523d22c373039e6d8b36fd96eba6

commit_message:
rt: ensure resource provider records exist from RT

This patch adds functionality to the scheduler "report client" to ensure
that the client calls the placement API to create a resource provider
record for the local compute host managed by the Nova resource tracker.

The report client keeps a cache of resource provider objects, keyed by
resource provider UUID and constructed from the results of placement
REST API calls to get information about a resource provider. If a
resource provider matching a UUID was not found in the placement REST
API, the report client automatically creates the resource provider
record via the placement REST API. These resource provider objects will
be used in followup patches that add creation of inventory and
allocation records to the scheduler report client.

Included in this patch is a new [placement] nova.conf configuration
section with a single os_region_name configuration option that allows
Nova to grab the placement API endpoint URL for the particular OpenStack
region that it is in. We do not support endpoint URL overrides for the
placement API service. We only use the Keystone service catalog for
finding the endpoint for the placement service. We intentionally modeled
the determination of the placement endpoint URL after similar code that
determines the volume endpoint URL in /nova/volume/cinder.py.

This redoes the placement API using keystone session, and stubs out
where we can do more reasonable handling of errors. This works if we
fill out the right credentials in the placement section of the config
file.

Co-Authored-By: Sean Dague <sean@dague.net>

Change-Id: I9d28b51da25c523d22c373039e6d8b36fd96eba6
blueprint: generic-resource-pools

commit_message:
Add API, S3 and Metadata services to puppet-ec2api

As second step to have puppet-ec2api module working,
this patch adds the API, S3 and Metadata services
to the skeleton of this module.

Change-Id: Ied75d3c234eae5533bd6393b4ca2259fbaefa9e4

commit_message:
Globalize authentication failure error

The authentication failure error during token
validation is currently not globalized. This
patch provides a fix for that.

Change-Id: If5ccdbfd2fc215e3d0013d45c8908344db20789e
Closes-Bug: 1614994

commit_message:
Power state may now be managed

This patch adds the necessary controllers and modals to power on,
power off, or reboot a node. Note that some drivers (the fake driver
for example) do not support reboot.

This patch also removes the UnknownAction controllers and modals,
as those are no longer used.

Change-Id: I3c9274c3e47dc82752c44bb978cb4209f503dea8

This API library handles calls to a node's power management API.

commit_message:
rt: write inventory records from resource tracker

This patch adds functionality to the scheduler report client, called
from the resource tracker, to call the placement REST API to add and set
inventory records for the resource provider representing the local
compute host. We use a similar strategy as the previous patch to
"ensure" a set of inventory records exists for the resource provider and
then check to see if inventory has changed before calling the placement
API to update total, reserved, and allocation_ratio values for vCPU,
RAM, and local disk resources.

Change-Id: I105c01275a84f6aefba853278eb3957ce741c1fa
blueprint: generic-resource-pools
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/83/363583/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from nova.objects import fieldsdef _compute_node_to_inventory_list(rp, compute_node): """Helper function to convert the supplied `objects.ComputeNode` into an `objects.InventoryList` containing inventory records for vCPU, RAM, and local disk. :param rp: `objects.ResourceProvider` object representing the compute host :param compute_node: `objects.ComputeNode` object to transform """ invs = [] # vCPU inv = objects.Inventory( resource_provider=rp, resource_class=fields.ResourceClass.VCPU, total=compute_node.vcpus, max_unit=compute_node.vcpus, allocation_ratio=compute_node.cpu_allocation_ratio, ) inv.obj_set_defaults() invs.append(inv) # RAM inv = objects.Inventory( resource_provider=rp, resource_class=fields.ResourceClass.MEMORY_MB, total=compute_node.memory_mb, reserved=compute_node.reserved_host_memory_mb, max_unit=compute_node.memory_mb, allocation_ratio=compute_node.ram_allocation_ratio, ) inv.obj_set_defaults() invs.append(inv) # Local disk inv = objects.Inventory( resource_provider=rp, resource_class=fields.ResourceClass.DISK_GB, total=compute_node.local_gb, max_unit=compute_node.local_gb, allocation_ratio=compute_node.disk_allocation_ratio, ) inv.obj_set_defaults() invs.append(inv) # TODO(jaypipes): Pass PCI device information into the report client and # handle generic PCI devices as regular ol' resources here. return objects.InventoryList(objects=invs) # A dict, keyed by resource provider UUID, of InventoryList objects for # each known resource provider. The local compute host will have an # InventoryList object, along with any associated provider of shared # resources such as shared disk storage. self._inventories = {} def put(self, url, data): return self._client.put( url, json=data, endpoint_filter=self.ks_filter, raise_exc=False) def _inventory_changed(self, rp, new_inv): """Given a supplied resource provider and inventory list, return True if the inventory has changed in any way, False otherwise. :param rp: resource provider to check :param new_inv: The inventory list to check against the cached inventory for the resource provider """ old_inv = self._inventories[rp.uuid] old_res_classes = set([i.resource_class for i in old_inv]) new_res_classes = set([i.resource_class for i in new_inv]) removed = old_res_classes - new_res_classes added = new_res_classes - old_res_classes existing = old_res_classes - removed - added changed = False if removed: # Some pre-existing inventory record for the resource provider has # been deleted since the last time we checked msg = _LI("Inventory for resources %(resource_classes)s no " "longer present.") resource_classes = [fields.ResourceClass.from_index(r) for r in removed] resource_classes = ",".join(resource_classes) msg = msg.format({'resource_classes': resource_classes}) LOG.info(msg) changed = True if added: # New inventory has appeared for some new resources that did not # exist the last time we checked msg = _LI("New inventory for resources %(resource_classes)s " "found.") resource_classes = [fields.ResourceClass.from_index(r) for r in added] resource_classes = ",".join(resource_classes) msg = msg.format({'resource_classes': resource_classes}) LOG.info(msg) changed = True for res_class in existing: old_item = old_inv.find(res_class) new_item = new_inv.find(res_class) if (old_item.total != new_item.total or old_item.reserved != new_item.reserved or old_item.allocation_ratio != new_item.allocation_ratio): msg = _LI("Inventory for resource %(resource_class)s has " "changed. Old inventory: %(old)s New inventory: " "%(new)s.") res_class_str = fields.ResourceClass.from_index(res_class) inv_format = "(total: %d, reserved: %d, alloc ratio: %0.2f)" old = inv_format.format(old_item.total, old_item.reserved, old_item.allocation_ratio) new = inv_format.format(new_item.total, new_item.reserved, new_item.allocation_ratio) msg = msg.format({ 'resource_class': res_class_str, 'old': old, 'new': new, }) LOG.info(msg) changed = True return changed def _get_inventory_for_resource_provider(self, rp): """Queries the placement API for the inventory records of a supplied resource provider. Returns an `objects.InventoryList` object if found or None if no such resource provider could be found. If the resource provider was found but had no inventory records, an `objects.InventoryList` is still returned, but will be empty. :param rp: `objects.ResourceProvider` object to look up inventory for """ rp_uuid = rp.uuid url = "/resource_providers/{0}/inventories".format(rp_uuid) resp = self.get(url) if resp.status_code == 200: data = resp.json() generation = data['resource_provider_generation'] if generation != rp.generation: # TODO(jaypipes): Grab a fresh resource provider record from # the placement API. Another thread has updated inventory or # allocations. Right now, nova-compute is the only thing that # is running this code, and we're protected by a semaphore # against the compute node so there's no other thread that # can update the inventory. pass invs = [] for res_class, inv_record in data['inventories'].items(): inv = objects.Inventory( resource_provider=rp, resource_class=res_class, total=inv_record['total'], reserved=inv_record['reserved'], min_unit=inv_record['min_unit'], max_unit=inv_record['max_unit'], step_size=inv_record['step_size'], allocation_ration=inv_record['allocation_ratio'], ) invs.append(inv) return objects.InventoryList(objects=invs) elif resp.status_code == 404: return None else: msg = _LE("Failed to retrieve inventory records from placement " "API for the resource provider with UUID %(uuid)s. " "Got %(status_code)d: %(err_text)s.") args = { 'uuid': rp_uuid, 'status_code': resp.status_code, 'err_text': resp.text, } LOG.error(msg, args) def _set_inventory_for_resource_provider(self, rp, new_inv): """Calls the placement API to set inventory records for a supplied resource provider. :param rp: Resource provider to update :param new_inv: `objects.InventoryList` to send to the placement API """ rp_uuid = rp.uuid url = "/resource_providers/{0}/inventories".format(rp_uuid) payload = { 'resource_provider_generation': rp.generation, 'inventories': { } } for inv in new_inv: res_class = fields.ResourceClass.from_index(inv.resource_class) payload['inventories'][res_class] = { 'total': inv.total, 'reserved': inv.reserved, 'allocation_ratio': inv.allocation_ratio, } resp = self.put(url, payload) if resp.status_code != 204: msg = _LE("Failed to set inventory records in placement API for " "the resource provider with UUID %(uuid)s. " "Got %(status_code)d: %(err_text)s.") args = { 'uuid': rp_uuid, 'status_code': resp.status_code, 'err_text': resp.text, } LOG.error(msg, args) def _ensure_inventory_for_resource_provider(self, rp, new_inv): """Ensures that the placement API has inventory records for a resource provider. If not, creates the inventory records for a resource provider using the supplied inventory list. The found or created inventory list object is returned from this method. If the inventory could not be created in the placement API, we return None. :param rp: Resource provider object to get or create inventory for. :param new_inv: `objects.InventoryList` object representing the inventory records to create if there did not exist any inventory records in the placemet API for the resource provider. """ if rp.uuid in self._inventories: return self._inventories[rp.uuid] inv = self._get_inventory_for_resource_provider(rp) if inv is None: inv = self._create_inventory_for_resource_provider(rp, new_inv) if inv is None: return self._inventories[rp.uuid] = inv return inv @safe_connect rp = self._ensure_resource_provider(compute_node.uuid, compute_node.hypervisor_hostname) if rp is not None: new_inv = _compute_node_to_inventory_list(rp, compute_node) cur_inv = self._ensure_inventory_for_resource_provider(rp, new_inv) if cur_inv is not None and self._inventory_changed(rp, new_inv): self._set_inventory_for_resource_provider(rp, new_inv)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-31 23:04:29.000000000', 'files': ['vif_plug_linux_bridge/tests/test_linux_net.py', 'vif_plug_linux_bridge/linux_net.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/os-vif/commit/ac8c8376249fde6a226f57c49c370d197602fb6a', 'message': 'Check for concurrent bridge creation in bridge add

With Linux bridge, either Neutron or Nova may create the bridge
associated with a network so this process must be robust to
concurrent creations of the same bridge.

This change just has the addbr call capture exceptions and avoid
reraising if the device already exists.

Closes-Bug: #1617447
Change-Id: Ib0266086e0caffecf3f9f2a8291369cfa155f386

commit_message:
Check for concurrent bridge creation in bridge add

With Linux bridge, either Neutron or Nova may create the bridge
associated with a network so this process must be robust to
concurrent creations of the same bridge.

This change just has the addbr call capture exceptions and avoid
reraising if the device already exists.

Closes-Bug: #1617447
Change-Id: Ib0266086e0caffecf3f9f2a8291369cfa155f386
(cherry picked from commit c25ce5a852d97f8159e77cb7ed71df31c482ce76)

added_lines: from oslo_utils import excutils try: processutils.execute('brctl', 'addbr', bridge) except Exception: with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception() as ectx: ectx.reraise = not device_exists(bridge)

commit_message:
Revert "Allow aggregations in search requests"

We need to resolve how to deal with global aggregations https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/2.3/search-aggregations-bucket-global-aggregation.html

This reverts commit f8e4e3e74ef1da2bed8f495a54fc46dda19bd798.

Change-Id: Ic30b5fb9a7cf00d787026cf5bd289c439be5a849

commit_message:
Remove neutron client workarounds

We have a workarounds for cases when calling neutronclient.create_port()
or neutronclient.list_ports() may return ports with empty id, or empty
data, without raising an exception. These workarounds mask the neutron
bugs rather than fixing the root cause.
Also for example Nova doesn't have such workarounds, please see
references. This changes removes the workarounds.
Also provisioning will be interrupted with NetworkError() only when we
failed to create all Neutron ports in provisioning network, if at least
one port is created successfully we proceed with deployment.

Reference:
[0]https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/71c007d9/nova/network/neutronv2/api.py#L1071
[1]https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/71c007d9/nova/network/neutronv2/api.py#L315

commit_message:
ceph: fix write emulation

Ceph does _not_ truncate data when writing(), which means we need to
copy back data that are not overwritten.

Change-Id: I27e839a0904f378bbab9b5d911e6a9ce6d4ac03c

commit_message:
Remove deprecated 'data' credential argument

The 'data' argument was deprecated in the 1.7.0 release
and should have been removed in the 2.0.0 release. It has
been replaced by the 'blob' argument.

Related-Bug: 1259461

Change-Id: I762f46f605a65abe73547ad6e522c54b1cc3aac6

commit_message:
Allow aggregations in search requests

Allows aggregations to be specified in search requests (either as
'aggs' or 'aggregations'). See Elasticsearch DSL for details
https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/search-aggregations.html

Change-Id: I3df53455053846bff32a5fb0b4e2dd618ecad096
Implements: blueprint allow-aggregation-query

commit_message:
Always return a sorted list of drivers for configs

glance.store entry point used in Glance for the store library is
resulting in generating random order in each run of the ``tox -e
genconfig`` command. This is because of the unsorted iterator returned
by the stevedore extension manager [1, 2].

This commit fixes that and returs a deterministic, sorted list of
drivers to generate the configs in Glance.

Example scenario is at change Iea2c538b37182191445cc5c1f8b2d9dceed06343

Closes-Bug: 1619487

[1] https://github.com/openstack/glance_store/blob/22fa2b08e76a8ebc39ade92504aeafb0bf8d2f8c/glance_store/backend.py#L135
[2] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/stevedore/managers.html#stevedore.extension.ExtensionManager.__iter__

Co-Authored-By: Joshua Harlow <jxharlow@godaddy.com>

Change-Id: I3146b8597a5d89da49b84d6653edacc3067c2c71

cherry-picked from commit b5833a87236183444589f3f93fba8641eb6c520a

Change-Id: I3fa697b546d315a46a0bebeee42f238d106a1c3c

commit_message:
Use list_servers for polling rather than get_server_by_id

Using get_server_by_id bypasses the list_server poll/cache. There is one
legit place where we should do this, but in the other places it causes
us to poll with great frequency unnecessarily.

The TaskManager test changes are just to get test discover to stop
finding then skipping the fixtures in the file.

Change-Id: I7f1e360f53d7344dfc996eb4c4813184720f8da0

commit_message:
Update tox.ini testenv section

Only the [testenv] section is changed here.

Other changes are ini file syntax standardization based on being
parsed and written by configparser.

Unfortunately, comments are not preserved by configparser.

Future updates using the same tool should have a cleaner diff.

Change-Id: Id8d20998056031faee24f9c61684978e2295b088

commit_message:
Update tox.ini testenv section

Only the [testenv] section is changed here.

Other changes are ini file syntax standardization based on being
parsed and written by configparser.

Unfortunately, comments are not preserved by configparser.

Future updates using the same tool should have a cleaner diff.

Change-Id: I098f5392fe5cd3de78ea2749d6db3aa84baf9b79

subject: Passed tokens may now be promises.
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/js-openstack-lib refs/changes/31/361431/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: * This method builds common components of a keystone request. It converts any passed token * into a promise, resolves the base URL, and then passes the results as an .all() promise, * which may be destructured in a followup request. * * @param {Promise|String} token A promise, or string, representing a token. * @returns {Promise} A promise which resolves with [url, token]. * @private */ _requestComponents (token = null) { // Make sure the token is a promise. let headerPromise = Promise .resolve(token) .then((token) => { if (token) { return { 'X-Auth-Token': token }; } return {}; }); return Promise.all([this.serviceEndpoint(), headerPromise]); } /** return Promise .all([this.serviceEndpoint(), token, adminToken]) .then(([url, token, adminToken]) => { return [url, { 'X-Subject-Token': token, 'X-Auth-Token': adminToken || token }]; }) .then(([url, headers]) => this.http.httpRequest('DELETE', `${url}auth/tokens`, headers)); ._requestComponents(token) .then(([url, headers]) => this.http.httpRequest('GET', `${url}auth/catalog`, headers))
deleted_lines: let headers = { 'X-Subject-Token': token, 'X-Auth-Token': adminToken || token }; return this.serviceEndpoint() .then((url) => this.http.httpRequest('DELETE', `${url}auth/tokens`, headers)); const headers = {}; if (token) { headers['X-Auth-Token'] = token; } .serviceEndpoint() .then((url) => this.http.httpRequest('GET', `${url}auth/catalog`, headers))

'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-01 11:14:06.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/storage/test_rbd.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/storage/rbd_utils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/3405a28688eacbca23cf5cac0a611d33fb1a1f2c', 'message': 'rbd_utils: wrap blocking calls in tpool.Proxy()

commit_message:
rbd_utils: wrap blocking calls in tpool.Proxy()

librbd is a Python binding around a C library, which is not aware of
eventlet - all the calls to the functions from this library will block
the whole nova-compute process for duration of a call. To make sure
nova-compute remains responsive we need to wrap all the calls in
tpool.Proxy() eventlet helper, that switches the execution context
back to the event loop, while the call is executed in a native OS
thread from a pool.

Prefer tpool.Proxy() to tpool.execute() here as the former allows for
wrapping objects and automatically executes all the method calls in
native OS threads, while the latter needs to be applied to each
method call in the code repeatedly.

Existing calls are modified for the sake of consistency.

Closes-Bug: #1607461

Change-Id: I743ab372332eb656258a476ae91f5e8fd2cbdc99
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/92/348492/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: rbd.RBD().clone(src_client.ioctx, image.encode('utf-8'), snapshot.encode('utf-8'), dest_client.ioctx, str(dest_name), features=src_client.features) rbd.RBD().remove(client.ioctx, name) rbd.RBD().remove(ioctx, volume) volumes = rbd.RBD().list(client.ioctx)

commit_message:
Introduce ironic::pxe class

We should provide option to setup PXE in order to remove PXE setup
from tripleo elements. Class ironic::pxe will setup tftpboot and
httpboot and class ironic::pxe::common will take care of common
dependancies between ironic, ironic inspector and pxe driver.

Change-Id: I8b83eff694316755e4dd2dbcde7b569472893bc5

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # Indernal define for coyping tftpboot files # # === Parameters # # [*source_directory*] # Directory to copy file from. # # [*destination_directory*] # Directory to copy files to. # # [*file*] # File to copy. # Defaults to namevar. # define ironic::ipxe::tftpboot_file ( $source_directory, $destination_directory, $file = $title, ) { file {"${destination_directory}/${file}": ensure => 'present', seltype => 'tftpdir_t', owner => 'ironic', group => 'ironic', mode => '0744', source => "${source_directory}/${file}", backup => false, } }

commit_message:
Updates drivers from BayModel to ClusterTemplate

Moves magnum.drivers from using Baymodel to ClusterTemplate naming to align
with bay to cluster blueprint.
First part of the rest of magnum.drivers update, with the next part renaming
Bay to Cluster.

Change-Id: I34c5a8bb2b2617b9a057cf7063d4749fa5a39f58
Implements: blueprint rename-bay-to-cluster

commit_message:
Fix the central repository to work with CentOS

Add interface drop for CentOS (Will need to be extended to allow
multiple interfaces)
Add network config files based on ansible_os_family.
Add nodepool tasks for CentOS
Add a default network file for both CentOS and Ubuntu

Change-Id: Ideb84f153fbd9f8f83ff39042f139b25719b39d8

commit_message:
Install python-dracclient and python-proliantutils on controllers

Ironic iLO and DRAC drivers are pretty popular, feature complete and work
better than the generic ipmitool driver in many cases. Installing these
two small Python modules allows them to work out of box in overcloud.

Change-Id: I63b68fda15fb8e2a8300830a497584857e3674b1
Partially-Implements: blueprint ironic-integration

commit_message:
use utils.key_value_pairs_to_dict()

utils.key_value_pairs_to_dict() was recently added to the
code base; utils.args_array_to_dict() calls
utils.key_value_pairs_to_dict().

This replaces calls to utils.args_array_to_dict() with calls
to utils.key_value_pairs_to_dict() when the latter is really
the goal. Doing this avoids creating a temporary dictionary.

Change-Id: I6295c9442e4ce4b4ad0ac2930eb2797f30683793
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-ironicclient refs/changes/74/364474/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: arguments = utils.args_array_to_dict( {'args': parsed_args.arg}, 'args')['args'] # If there were no arguments for the method, arguments will still # be an empty list. So make it an empty dict. if not arguments: arguments = {}

commit_message:
Include jsonschema only once in requirements

Including it in both requirements.txt and test-requirements.txt
gives "Double requirement given" error when rebuilding venv.

Change-Id: I612117f736c15d71864235050e46175bcd775fc8

commit_message:
Add validations for container operations

Change-Id: I4247c7867ef81112083f933cf54d33a37cd118c9
Closes-Bug: #1614386
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zun refs/changes/14/364214/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: VALID_STATES = { 'delete': 'STOPPED', 'start': 'STOPPED', 'stop': 'RUNNING', 'reboot': 'RUNNING', 'pause': 'RUNNING', 'unpause': 'PAUSED', } def _validate_container_state(self, container, action): if container.status != VALID_STATES[action]: raise exception.InvalidStateException( id=container.container_id, required_state=VALID_STATES[action], actual_state=container.status) self._validate_container_state(container, 'delete') self._validate_container_state(container, 'reboot') self._validate_container_state(container, 'stop') self._validate_container_state(container, 'start') self._validate_container_state(container, 'pause') self._validate_container_state(container, 'unpause')

commit_message:
Add release note to warn about os-brick lock dir

Not really a new bug, but turns out this wasn't generally known
or documented anywhere. As a heads up for folks we'll put in a
known issue into the release note for N.

Change-Id: Ied267c84dee2473e592eb737baab630954a2b5b3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/01/354501/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- issues: - When running Nova Compute and Cinder Volume or Backup services on the same host they must use a shared lock directory to avoid volume operation failures. This is done by setting "lock_path" in the "oslo_concurrency" section of nova.conf and cinder.conf.

'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-19 09:56:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/c087230c400762d7d06d5406f945b566b4d7d830', 'message': 'Add standard attributes to qospolicy

This adds the standard attributes relationship to QoSPolicy.
This has the advantage of providing created_at and updated_at,
however, the primary reason is to ensure it has a revision number

commit_message:
Add standard attributes to qospolicy

This adds the standard attributes relationship to QoSPolicy.
This has the advantage of providing created_at and updated_at,
however, the primary reason is to ensure it has a revision number
so QoSPolicy objects can be safely used in push notifications.

Partially-Implements: blueprint push-notifications
Change-Id: I8c0c33eef5d53c704b609e5bc503f46f5caad1bb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/28/357228/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Version 1.2: Added standard attributes (created_at, revision, etc) VERSION = '1.2' if _target_version < (1, 2): standard_fields = ['revision_number', 'created_at', 'updated_at'] for f in standard_fields: primitive.pop(f)

commit_message:
Consolidate configure docker storage fragments

In this commit configure-docker-storage.sh file has been removed
from k8s coreos, fedora and swarm driver and put at the common
location to avoid duplicacy and redundancy of code.

Partial-bug: #1517218
Change-Id: Ie467c1691cc148435da47448d31c35e7a1865984

commit_message:
wait to publish releases.o.o until after tagging

We should wait to publish the new version of the releases site until
after the tagging job finishes. That way if it fails, we don't publish
bad information.

Change-Id: I2d86516ec2d4a14376e01a022432e8ce99f196fd
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Rename BayModel DB, Object, and internal usage to ClusterTemplate

This patch is the first of 3 patches to change the internal
usage of the terms Bay and BayModel. This patch updates
BayModel to ClusterTemplate. No functionality should be
changed by this patch, just naming and db updates.

Change-Id: I0803e81be6482962be2878a8ea2c7480f89111ac
Implements: blueprint rename-bay-to-cluster

subject: Allow any data to be passed to yaql function
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-31 19:32:01.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/hot/functions.py', 'heat/tests/test_hot.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/094a146ea29715a84c1cc6b42e8f3718f82538bf', 'message': "Allow any data to be passed to yaql function

There's no reason whatsoever that we can't pass data of any type, not
just dicts, to YAQL. It happily accepts lists, strings, ints, &c. Even
if it did not, we are actually passing a dict with a key named 'data'
that contains the actual data, so the data passed to YAQL is always a
dict. There's even less reason to restrict the contents of that first
key to also be a dict.

Since Newton will be the first release to include the yaql function, we
can relax the type checking now without creating any backward
compatibility issues.

This change does that and also simplifies the implementation of the Yaql
function class and stops it from doing dodgy things like overwriting the
expression with its resolved value.

Change-Id: Ia2c699f965c7fb59f74cc36fb1e14200dbbf7e74
"}]
commit_message:
Allow any data to be passed to yaql function

There's no reason whatsoever that we can't pass data of any type, not
just dicts, to YAQL. It happily accepts lists, strings, ints, &c. Even
if it did not, we are actually passing a dict with a key named 'data'
that contains the actual data, so the data passed to YAQL is always a
dict. There's even less reason to restrict the contents of that first
key to also be a dict.

Since Newton will be the first release to include the yaql function, we
can relax the type checking now without creating any backward
compatibility issues.

This change does that and also simplifies the implementation of the Yaql
function class and stops it from doing dodgy things like overwriting the
expression with its resolved value.

Change-Id: Ia2c699f965c7fb59f74cc36fb1e14200dbbf7e74

commit_message:
Fixes Monasca ceph detection plugin for multi-cluster

Adds support for multi-cluster Ceph deployments and
multiple ceph config files

Change-Id: Ib05a5366155ba5c6c4858bf9aa2604b3c4214838
Closes-Bug: #1619241

added_lines: def _service_config(self, clusters, service_type): for cluster in clusters: cluster_name = cluster['cluster_name'] instance_list = list() # Get the list of daemon identifiers for given cluster if os.path.exists(service_dir): instance_list = [entry for entry in os.listdir(service_dir) if entry.startswith(cluster_name)] for instance in instance_list: # Daemon identifier is of format <cluster_name>-<id> # 'id' for ceph-mon is alphanumeric and is usually the hostname # where the service is running for ceph-mon # E.g., ceph-monitor1.dom, ceph-monitor2.dom etc. # # 'id' for ceph-osd is a unique numeric index for # that OSD in the cluster # E.g., ceph-1, ceph-2 etc. # # 'id' for ceph-mds is alphanumeric and is usually the hostname # where the service is running. # E.g., ceph-mds1.dom, ceph-mds2.dom etc. daemon_id = instance.split(cluster_name + '-', 1)[1] process = dict() process_args = ['--cluster %s' % cluster_name, '--id %s' % daemon_id, '-f'] process['search_string'] = self._build_search_string( executable, process_args) process['name'] = '%s-%s.%s' \ % (cluster_name, service_type, daemon_id) process['type'] = display_name expected_processes.append(process) def _radosgw_config(self, clusters): for cluster in clusters: cluster_name = cluster['cluster_name'] config_file = cluster['config_file'] instance_list = list() # Get the list of daemon identifiers for given cluster if os.path.exists(service_dir): instance_list = [entry for entry in os.listdir(service_dir) if entry.startswith(cluster_name)] for instance in instance_list: # RADOS Gateway processes is of the format: # /usr/bin/radosgw -c <config_file> -n <rados_username> # /usr/bin/radosgw -c ceph.conf -n client.radosgw.gateway process = dict() # The rados user will have a designated data directory, of the # format ceph-radosw.<rados_username> in the service dir. # E.g., /var/lib/ceph/radosgw/ceph-radosgw.gateway rados_username = instance.replace('ceph-radosgw.', '') process['search_string'] = list() process['name'] = '%s-radosgw.%s' \ % (cluster_name, rados_username) process['type'] = \ self.service_constants['radosgw']['display_name'] executable = self.service_constants['radosgw']['executable'] process_options = ['-n client.radosgw.%s' % rados_username, '--name=client.radosgw.%s' % rados_username] for opt in process_options: # Adding multiple combinations for all possible use cases, # since any of the following combination can be used to # start the process # Trivial case (This will be the most used scenario) # E.g., # /usr/bin/radosgw -n client.radosgw.gateway process['search_string'].append( '%s %s' % (executable, opt)) # Service started with specific conf file (For rare cases) # E.g., # /usr/bin/radosgw -c custom.conf -n client.radosgw.gateway process['search_string'].append( '%s -c %s %s' % (executable, config_file, opt)) process['search_string'].append( '%s --conf=%s %s' % (executable, config_file, opt)) expected_processes.append(process) # There may be multiple clusters, and we construct a list of dicts # containing cluster_name and config_file for each cluster clusters = list() for config_file in config_files: cluster_dict = dict() cluster_dict['cluster_name'] = config_file[:-5] cluster_dict['config_file'] = \ os.path.join(self.ceph_config_dir, config_file) clusters.append(cluster_dict) expected_processes.extend(self._service_config(clusters, 'mon')) expected_processes.extend(self._service_config(clusters, 'osd')) expected_processes.extend(self._service_config(clusters, 'mds')) expected_processes.extend(self._radosgw_config(clusters))

commit_message:
d/watch: fix the watch file by downloading from fedorahosted

The watch file that use GitHub does not work. Since the release tarballs
are uploaded to fedorahosted whose index is easier to parse, this patch
modifies the watch file to query fedorahosted instead.

Change-Id: Ie797d1c3969eca062e2d8b657a812cb99b7bfb21
Signed-off-by: Christophe Vu-Brugier <cvubrugier@fastmail.fm>

commit_message:
Support configuration and dependencies for iLO and Drac drivers

Provides two new manifests for installing the dependencies for these
drivers (python-dracclient and python-proliantutils).

Also provides a couple of useful options for the iLO driver.

Change-Id: Ibf1ed5253aacbbd88157d34d0c91bb909afb644c

commit_message:
Move snmp settings into composable services

Provides snmp_readonly_user_* parameters to the base::snmp class
and removes them from the role templates.

Related-bug: #1604414

Co-Authored-By: Giulio Fidente <gfidente@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I35b1ff23baff0c25e742562e1103a3882f7bf767

commit_message:
Fixes credential key rotation

We had a subtle bug that the base Manager was caching the value of
the primary_key_hash property. This was due to the fact that
keystone.common.manager.Manager.__getattr__ was not designed to be
used with properties.

Change-Id: I572c676a003099877403fc7bbb630dfa7bb7863a

commit_message:
int is not valid column type

int, as a column type in SQLAlchemy, is not
valid identifier. Instead sqlalchemy.Integer
should be used

Change-Id: Ibf6d7696de43de07da45ef4d42a04e4e3b862060

subject: Class Credentials not define __ne__() built-in function
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-14 07:33:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/ecec25889f74149650a8040952280cc578f4c326', 'message': 'base.Resource not define __ne__() built-in function

Class base.Resource defines __eq__() built-in function, but does
not define __ne__() built-in function, so self.assertEqual works
but self.assertNotEqual does not work at all in this test case in
python2. This patch fixes it by defining __eq__() built-in function
of class base.Resource. Also fixes spelling errors:resoruces.

Change-Id: I2c0d9d6202d64de57700ceb7c15db8ed3ad7e8ff
Closes-Bug: #1586268

but self.assertNotEqual does not work at all in this test case in

commit_message:
Class Credentials not define __ne__() built-in function

Class Credentials defines __eq__() built-in function, but does
not define __ne__() built-in function, so self.assertEqual works
but self.assertNotEqual does not work at all in this test case in
python2. This patch fixes it.

Change-Id: I2c0d9d6202d64de57700ceb7c15db8ed3ad7e8ff
Closes-Bug: #1586268

commit_message:
Delete dynamic tenant correctly when _cleanup_default_secgroup fails

When clearing dynamic credentials, if something goes wrong in
_cleanup_default_secgroup, the dynamic tenant will be left over.
This is to correct this.

Change-Id: I1196ea4239b2d03ed19143da5c9dc4bd81084c28
Closes-Bug: #1586930

commit_message:
Restart only services that need it

With new pacemaker architecture, Puppet handles restarts of most of the
services. There are several still managed by pacemaker which need
special restart handling utilizing pacemaker and its resource
agents.

The counterpart in puppet-tripleo requests restarts for individual
pacemaker-managed services by writing out "restart flag" files, and the
pacemaker_resource_restart.sh script then performs the restarts.

Change-Id: Ia4e6a9f88181f1981993f046cf415dbbcdc9570e
Closes-Bug: #1614967
Closes-Bug: #1587015
Depends-On: I6369ab0c82dbf3c8f21043f8aa9ab810744ddc12
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/11/358511/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: "$(hiera bootstrap_nodeid)" = "$(facter hostname)" ]; then TIMEOUT=600 for service in $(ls /var/lib/tripleo/pacemaker-restarts); do if ! pcs status | grep $service; then echo "Service $service not found as a pacemaker resource, cannot restart it." exit 1 fi echo "Restarting $service..." pcs resource restart --wait=$TIMEOUT $service rm /var/lib/tripleo/pacemaker-restarts/$service done
deleted_lines: "$(hiera bootstrap_nodeid)" = "$(facter hostname)" -a \ "$(hiera stack_action)" = "UPDATE" ]; then #ensure neutron constraints like #https://review.openstack.org/#/c/245093/ if pcs constraint order show | grep "start neutron-server-clone then start neutron-ovs-cleanup-clone"; then pcs constraint remove order-neutron-server-clone-neutron-ovs-cleanup-clone-mandatory fi pcs resource disable httpd check_resource httpd stopped 300 pcs resource disable openstack-core check_resource openstack-core stopped 1800 if pcs status | grep haproxy-clone; then pcs resource restart haproxy-clone fi pcs resource restart redis-master pcs resource restart mongod-clone pcs resource restart rabbitmq-clone pcs resource restart memcached-clone pcs resource restart galera-master pcs resource enable openstack-core check_resource openstack-core started 1800 pcs resource enable httpd check_resource httpd started 800

commit_message:
Update of cliff to v2.2.0

 * Add build time dependencies
 * Fixed %check - previously call of test did nothing due absence
   of testrepository and wrong call of test itself.
   Tests call got from tox.ini
 * setup.py test do nothing except downloading test-requirements
   and exits with exit code 0
 * remove pbr from runtime dependency

Change-Id: I9f4e7d67cd4a3953148120b11191b2e34515b318

commit_message:
Refactor _ipam_get_subnets

This method was difficult to reason about. This refactoring preserves the
original behavior but reduces code duplication and gathers all of the error
reporting logic in to one section so that future patches can more easily
optimize it.

Unit tests from these packages cover this area well.

    neutron.tests.unit.extensions.test_segment
    neutron.tests.unit.extensions.test_subnet_service_types

Change-Id: I074f34f3d8bc4135664a94dee11ed01c952d2f3e
Partially-Implements: blueprint service-subnets
