added_lines: def _query_subnets_on_network(self, context, network_id): query = self._get_collection_query(context, models_v2.Subnet) return query.filter(models_v2.Subnet.network_id == network_id) @staticmethod def _query_filter_by_segment_host_mapping(query, host): return query @staticmethod def _query_exclude_subnets_on_segments(query): # Host isn't known. Subnets attached to segments aren't considered return query.filter(models_v2.Subnet.segment_id.is_(None)) def _ipam_get_subnets(self, context, network_id, host, service_type=None): query = self._query_subnets_on_network(context, network_id) query = self._query_filter_service_subnets(query, service_type) def host_is_set(host): # This seems redundant, but its not. Host is unset if its None, '', # or ATTR_NOT_SPECIFIED due to differences in host binding # implementations. return host and validators.is_attr_set(host) def make_subnet_dict_list(subnets): """Prioritize the subnet list. Raise appropriate error if empty""" subnets = [self._make_subnet_dict(subnet, context=context) for subnet in subnets] if subnets: # Give priority to subnets with service_types return sorted( subnets, key=lambda subnet: not subnet.get('service_types')) # Why no subnets? Determine why to produce the right error. query = self._query_subnets_on_network(context, network_id) if host_is_set(host): # Empty because host isn't mapped to a segment with a subnet? subnets = query.filter(models_v2.Subnet.segment_id.isnot(None)) if subnets.limit(1).count() != 0: # It is a routed network but no subnets found for host raise segment_exc.HostNotConnectedToAnySegment( host=host, network_id=network_id) if not query.limit(1).count(): # Network has *no* subnets of any kind. This isn't an error. # Does filtering ineligible service subnets makes the list empty? query = self._query_filter_service_subnets(query, service_type) if query.limit(1).count(): # No, must be a deferred IP port because there are matching # subnets. Happens on routed networks when host isn't known. return [] raise ipam_exceptions.IpAddressGenerationFailureNoMatchingSubnet() # Select candidate subnets and return them if not host_is_set(host): # If the host isn't known, we can't allocate on a routed network. # So, exclude any subnets attached to segments. return make_subnet_dict_list( self._query_exclude_subnets_on_segments(query)) # The host is known. Consider both routed and non-routed networks results = self._query_filter_by_segment_host_mapping(query, host).all() return make_subnet_dict_list(subnet for subnet, _mapping in results)
deleted_lines: def _check_service_subnets(self, query, service_type): """Raise an exception if empty subnet list is caused by service type""" if not query.limit(1).count(): return query = self._query_filter_service_subnets(query, service_type) if query.limit(1).count(): return raise ipam_exceptions.IpAddressGenerationFailureNoMatchingSubnet() def _sort_service_subnets(self, subnets, query, service_type): """Give priority to subnets with service_types""" subnets = sorted(subnets, key=lambda subnet: not subnet.get('service_types')) if not subnets: # If we have an empty subnet list, check if it's caused by # the service type. self._check_service_subnets(query, service_type) return subnets def _ipam_get_subnets(self, context, network_id, host, service_type=None): unfiltered_query = self._get_collection_query(context, Subnet) unfiltered_query = unfiltered_query.filter( Subnet.network_id == network_id) query = self._query_filter_service_subnets(unfiltered_query, service_type) # Note: This seems redundant, but its not. It has to cover cases # where host is None, ATTR_NOT_SPECIFIED, or '' due to differences in # host binding implementations. if not validators.is_attr_set(host) or not host: query = query.filter(Subnet.segment_id.is_(None)) return self._sort_service_subnets( [self._make_subnet_dict(c, context=context) for c in query], unfiltered_query, service_type) results = query.all() # See if results are empty because the host isn't mapped to a segment if not results: # Check if it's a routed network (i.e subnets on segments) query = self._get_collection_query(context, Subnet) query = query.filter(Subnet.network_id == network_id) query = query.filter(Subnet.segment_id.isnot(None)) if query.count() == 0: self._check_service_subnets(unfiltered_query, service_type) # It is a routed network but no subnets found for host raise segment_exc.HostNotConnectedToAnySegment( host=host, network_id=network_id) return self._sort_service_subnets( [self._make_subnet_dict(subnet, context=context) for subnet, _mapping in results], unfiltered_query, service_type)

commit_message:
[Ambari] More flexible auto configuration

Per [0] there are four strategies that can be used
for autoconfiguration in Ambari. We are providing ability to specify that.

[0] https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/AMBARI/Blueprints

Change-Id: Ia73d289cfe7eb230fd86f43865eb392f0d4c02da

subject: do not fail if there are no constraint updates to push
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-01 15:58:48.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/scripts/release-tools/release.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/fca044a1eb0c7d6a8e336b0606720fd813dbd572', 'message': 'do not fail if there are no constraint updates to push

We have been assuming that everything that looks like a library appears
in the upper constraints list and so there would be an update to
review. When that assumption is false the commit step exits with an
error that causes the job to appear to fail, even though it has
not. Intercept the error and report that we are skipping the step
instead of exiting with an error.

Change-Id: Ie185b86735bd91d566a1017c6c98073779ba71f7
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
do not fail if there are no constraint updates to push

We have been assuming that everything that looks like a library appears
in the upper constraints list and so there would be an update to
review. When that assumption is false the commit step exits with an
error that causes the job to appear to fail, even though it has
not. Intercept the error and report that we are skipping the step
instead of exiting with an error.

Change-Id: Ie185b86735bd91d566a1017c6c98073779ba71f7
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Add merge commit ACL for packaging-deb

As discuss on IRC, we should have a long therm goal to use the overlay
mode of git-buildpackage. Though it's already very late in the Newton
release and the team still hope to release Newton using OpenStack infra.
Switching to the overlay mode of git-buildpackage would imply:
1/ Rewriting some of the build script
2/ Somehow use git filter-branch on all repositories, in order to clean
everything.

None of the actions above can be achieve in a reasonable timeframe.
Therefore, the only option we have so that the packaging-deb can move
forward, is to allow "merge commits" for the moment, so we can merge
upstream tags matching a new release, until we can switch to the overlay
mode of git-buildpackage.

Change-Id: Ied8519607fcbe08494daaebf05ea980d120bab0d

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-05-08 19:34:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/06b957a641f4f41e271b50e281fcbc4f4877b85e', 'message': "Forcing a configdrive in cfg should populate DB.

If you force a config drive for all instances, then it should result
in the config_drive column for the instance being set to true in the
instances table.

I've moved populating the instance column from the flag as early as
I can -- its now done in instance_create in the db API.

Change-Id: I09107a7f1e9b2e67f0fcd19dce8fd063d69e1632
Closes-Bug: #1303714
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-06-04 09:07:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/b6a0114a973971faa6f343bc28927d4266829bf0', 'message': "Forcing a configdrive in cfg should populate DB.

If you force a config drive for all instances, then it should result
in the config_drive column for the instance being set to true in the
instances table. Also, this should only happen on first boot of an
instance, not for things like hard reboots.

This change means we can't just use force_config_drive as short
hand in testing for virt drivers, so there's some related fallout
there.

DocImpact: the force_config_drive flag is only used on first boot
of an instance. We should tell cloud admins about this.

Change-Id: I09107a7f1e9b2e67f0fcd19dce8fd063d69e1632

commit_message:
Forcing a configdrive in cfg should populate DB

If you force a config drive for all instances, then it should result
in the config_drive column for the instance being set to true in the
instances table. Also, this should only happen on first boot of an
instance, not for things like hard reboots.

This change means we can't just use 'force_config_drive' as short
hand in testing for virt drivers, so there's some related fallout
there.

While we're at it, change the 'configdrive.required_by' function to
return a Boolean. All calls to this function expected this kind of
result.

DocImpact: the force_config_drive flag is only used on first boot
of an instance. We should tell cloud admins about this.

Change-Id: I09107a7f1e9b2e67f0fcd19dce8fd063d69e1632
Co-Authored-By: Stephen Finucane <stephen.finucane@intel.com>
Closes-Bug: #1303714
Closes-Bug: #1241806

Note that # the DB column is a string for historical reasons. if CONF.force_config_drive: values['config_drive'] = 'true'

Add lower() method to self.name.

subject: networking-hyperv: remove type:library tag
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-02 12:43:52.000000000', 'files': ['reference/projects.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/governance/commit/e0e1ef4ef5a1622932712c02c1e6de224b499907', 'message': 'networking-hyperv: remove type:library tag

networking-hyperv is not a library. It only offers the following
things:

- neutron-hyperv-agent, which is a Neutron L2 Agent which runs
on Hyper-V hosts, responsible with binding neutron ports and
security groups, and updating them on RPC calls.
- Hyper-V Neutron ML2 mechanism driver, consumed by Neutron

'}]
commit_message:
networking-hyperv: remove type:library tag

networking-hyperv is not a library. It only offers the following
things:

- neutron-hyperv-agent, which is a Neutron L2 Agent which runs
on Hyper-V hosts, responsible with binding neutron ports and
security groups, and updating them on RPC calls.
- Hyper-V Neutron ML2 mechanism driver, consumed by Neutron
when binding ports to a Hyper-V host.

Change-Id: I30b9a10e58c36948b088bc60caa3f2ee5b334f8a

commit_message:
do not error if a branch already exists

When we run batch operations to create a lot of stable branches at one
time, sometimes we have to run the script more than once and sometimes
we mistakenly run it against the same repo more than once. It's safe to
ignore the existing branch, so don't treat it like an error.

Change-Id: I60dd4d0a30da0ca5d1913c309f24010ab0d446dd
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Add nova-stable-maint to os-vif gerrit ACL

os-vif's first stable branch is stable/newton but
we already have backports proposed so make
nova-stable-maint  the core team for stable branch
changes in that repo. This is the same as what we do
for python-novaclient.

Change-Id: Idb4d38f6e23dae111e0f041dac9ecd6b877b9b49

commit_message:
Add cinder-stable-maint to os-brick

os-brick didn't have any gerrit ACL defined for stable
branch maintenance, this adds it. This is the same as
what's defined for python-cinderclient.

Change-Id: I1ec3dfddc5a975562221f3cff5f938fcac5941f4

commit_message:
Fix log collection when VMs are created with non-default names

The change I4c9eec82882d94649ee0e6bdb7e2ce033c29e44a introduced the
ability to create VMs with user defined names. This change aligns
the VM log collection accordingly.

Change-Id: I8c4895a8f49749b6845a804b02ad64bc227ec3ec
Signed-off-by: Fatih Degirmenci <fatih.degirmenci@ericsson.com>

'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-17 18:52:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/b323bdac0a37c11e414a14edf121a3d93362635c', 'message': 'Add replication failback in Kaminario K2 drivers

Replication failback support is added based on active_backend_id
in Kaminario K2 iSCSI and FC Cinder drivers.
Use "cinder failover-host" command to switch between failover and
failback based on active_backend_id.
If active_backend_id is secondary array, "cinder failover-host"
will trigger failback code.
Below are the steps as part of failback:
1)Search "failed-over" sessions on secondary array.
2)Change state of "failed-over" sessions to "in-sync".
  This will reverse the replication direction from secondary
  to primary.
3)Create external snapshots and synced to primary array volumes
4)Change state of "in-sync" sessions on primary to "failed-over".
5)Change state of "failed-over" sessions to "in-sync".
  This will reverse the replication direction from primary to
  secondary.

DocImpact

commit_message:
Add replication failback in Kaminario K2 drivers

Replication failback support is added based on active_backend_id
in Kaminario K2 iSCSI and FC Cinder drivers.
Use "cinder failover-host" command to switch between failover and
failback based on active_backend_id.
If active_backend_id is secondary array, "cinder failover-host"
will trigger failback code.
Below are the steps as part of failback:
1)Search "failed-over" sessions on secondary array.
2)Change state of "failed-over" sessions to "in-sync".
  This will reverse the replication direction from secondary
  to primary.
3)Create external snapshots and synced to primary array volumes
4)Change state of "in-sync" sessions on primary to "failed-over".
5)Change state of "failed-over" sessions to "in-sync".
  This will reverse the replication direction from primary to
  secondary.

Also, updated releasenotes of bug #1608913
DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1615178
Co-Authored-By: Nikesh Mahalka<Nikesh.Mahalka.ctr@kaminario.com>
Co-Authored-By: Sreedhar Varma<Sreedhar.Varma.ctr@kaminario.com>
Co-Authored-By: Lakshman<Lakshmi.Narayana.ctr@kaminario.com>
Co-Authored-By: Ido Benda<Ido.Benda@kaminario.com>
Change-Id: I664516ab31f9d33e4d14cd8615a1e0da4dba15b6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/75/356475/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Upgrade ceph-osd

Upgrades the ceph-osd daemon from Hammer to Jewel

Change-Id: Idfa90fdc0052c53f448401c85c5d13a2ba68acd1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/12/357312/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ceph osd set norebalance OSD_IDS=\$(ls /var/lib/ceph/osd | awk 'BEGIN { FS = "-" } ; { print $2 }') OSD_PIDS=\$(pidof ceph-osd) # Stop daemon using Hammer sysvinit script for OSD_ID in OSD_IDS; do service ceph stop osd.\${OSD_ID} done # Nice guy will return non-0 only when all failed while kill -0 \${OSD_PIDS} 2> /dev/null; do sleep 1; done; # Update to Jewelyum -y update ceph-osd # RPM could own some of these but we can't take risks on the pre-existing files chown -R ceph:ceph /var/lib/ceph/osd chown -R ceph:ceph /var/log/ceph chown -R ceph:ceph /var/run/ceph chown -R ceph:ceph /etc/ceph # Replay udev events with newer rules udevadm trigger # Enable systemd unit systemctl enable ceph-osd.target for OSD_ID in OSD_IDS; do systemctl enable ceph-osd@\${OSD_ID} systemctl start ceph-osd@\${OSD_ID} doneceph osd unset norebalance
deleted_lines: function systemctl_ceph { action=\$1 systemctl \$action ceph } systemctl_ceph stopyum -y update systemctl_ceph start

commit_message:
Allow different key/cert for the admin apache vhost

The admin endpoint might be serving with a different IP and
servername, so it might need a different set of keys/certs. This
commit gives it the ability to do so, while still having backwards
compatibility, since, if no admin key/cert is given, it will use the
pair that the public endpoint uses.

Change-Id: I8725bb39f6473e4837cbd0c553295c2340f20913
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-keystone refs/changes/72/364172/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: describe 'when setting ssl cert and key' do let :params do { :ssl_cert => 'some cert', :ssl_key => 'some key', } end it { is_expected.to contain_apache__vhost('keystone_wsgi_main').with( 'ssl_cert' => 'some cert', 'ssl_key' => 'some key', )} it { is_expected.to contain_apache__vhost('keystone_wsgi_admin').with( 'ssl_cert' => 'some cert', 'ssl_key' => 'some key', )} end describe 'when setting different ssl cert and key for admin' do let :params do { :ssl_cert => 'some cert', :ssl_key => 'some key', :ssl_cert_admin => 'some cert admin', :ssl_key_admin => 'some key admin', } end it { is_expected.to contain_apache__vhost('keystone_wsgi_main').with( 'ssl_cert' => 'some cert', 'ssl_key' => 'some key', )} it { is_expected.to contain_apache__vhost('keystone_wsgi_admin').with( 'ssl_cert' => 'some cert admin', 'ssl_key' => 'some key admin', )} end

commit_message:
Fix doc deprecated parameter

The documentation refers to keystone_identity_uri as being
deprecated in favor of aodh::keystone::authtoken::auth_uri
when it really is aodh::keystone::authtoken::auth_url.

Change-Id: I28f43b0e2ed1359811c68d2e0f25ff9eba17749c
